However, I bought some Duracell rechargeable NiMH 1.2V 2450mAh batteries and this solved the problem. Charge all 4 batteries. Put 2 in the camera and store the other 2 in your bag and you will be fine for dozens of photos. Recording video takes lots of energy. I think the image quality is good. I haven't had time to use all the settings, but I'm happy overall with the results. Pictures taken with the flash indoors are very good quality, although again, the flash uses lots of energy. My previous camera was a Canon PowerShot A620. It took 4 AA batteries and I could literally take hundreds of photos with 4 rechargeable batteries. This camera only takes 2 batteries, so I need to recharge the batteries more frequently. The LCD screen can be somewhat hard to see depending on the lighting conditions. I do really miss the variable angle screen on the A620, however, this camera has a much larger screen which makes previewing photos much easier. The image stabilization works well. The A620 did not have this and I find photos taken in low light without flash turn out well. Some people might think this camera is too big, but I prefer a slightly larger camera because I like having the dials and buttons probably because I learned photography on a 35mm SLR and I still do manipulate settings like Tv and Av. I bought this camera on clearance at a store for $79, so I am happy with the results for the amount of money I paid for it.

Reviews.Title: This is a great little camera
Reviews.Author: YumaBelle
Reviews.Content: Exactly what I wanted.  I hated taking pictures with my cell phone and this is the perfect alternative for me.  Easy point and shoot.  Great pictures.  I have not gone to the reusable batteries yet as I have not really gone through batteries as quick as I thought I would.  The flash is perfect for getting just the right amount of light for inside pictures. I'm really very happy with this camera.  Not too big and not too small either.

Reviews.Title: battery problem
Reviews.Author: Mi Kyoung Hwang
Reviews.Content: The battery is too~~ short. Except the battery, it is good for the beginners who want to take a picture in manual mode.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: joe.hardhat
Reviews.Content: The camera was purchased to replace a Canon camera purchased 5 years ago. The old camera worked well but this one was on sale and had a better optical zoom. When I started using the camera I noticed it worked much better in low light conditions and with the increased megepixels produced much better pictures. It was easy to crop the pictures later and still have plenty of definition left. It works on regular AA bateries so when the bateries are low all you have to do is put a new set in and you are good for a while. Batteries seem to last a long time and if you use the special Energizer lithium batteries they can last for months. I would buy a similar camera again, in fact, I did buy another for my wife.

Reviews.Title: Replaced the one she wore out
Reviews.Author: Klennea
Reviews.Content: Selected off gift registry for family member.  The Canon PowerShot owned prior to this was used for years.  This may seemingly lack some of the bells and whistles, but it is a sturdy, reliable camera that takes excellent pictures.

Reviews.Title: What a great camera!
Reviews.Author: barbara
Reviews.Content: I LOVE my canon powershot.  Easy to use for us not so "techy" people. Takes GREAT pictures, easy to transfer to computer. Well done Canon!

Reviews.Title: this camera is very cool
Reviews.Author: Viola Owens
Reviews.Content: This does everything I need it to do. I really enjoy taking pictures with it. The only thing I dont like is it takes AA battiers.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: ann lowe
Reviews.Content: You cannot go wrong with this camera. The family has 4 of them. W had to buy a new one to replace one that went swimming.  Love that you can AA batteries and don't have to use their special batteries.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: Heidi Romano
Reviews.Content: I had an older model PowerShot that broke after two years on constant use.  It was $600 for the camera and accessories.  I bought this one for a fraction of the price and it blew me away with its quality.  Canon has improved the camera's ability to take sharp pictures without any need for camera expertise.  It is worth learning how to use the extra functions though.  It has many settings for lighting, sound, focus, flash, self-timer, date stamp.  It has a good zoom and great flash with lots of settings for any type of lighting you intend to shoot in:  daytime, nighttime, indoor incandescent or fluorescent, etc.  A bargain for a wonderful camera.  I highly recommend Canon as one of the best cameras on the market and certainly the best camera for the investment.

Reviews.Title: Still use it and still like it
Reviews.Author: Natalie
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera overall. I had the previous version to this camera as well. There are cameras out now that offer the same or more and in a much smaller package, but I didn't have enough to buy those at the time of my purchase, so I opted for getting high quality for less cost, but with a slightly larger camera (its still not crazy big or anything) I keep in in my normal size purse.The one main thing with this camera as was with the earlier version of it as well is the flash is SLOW!  You cannot take quick pictures in lighting where the flash is needed. However, you don't need the flash all that often because it takes great pictures without it most of the time and then it takes the pictures fast. Other than that, it is so easy to maneuver the settings of this camera and the zoom/recording is great.

Reviews.Title: Not recommended
Reviews.Author: Jorge C. Morales
Reviews.Content: Not recommended, mainly batterias problem with that did not last long, I've tried all kinds of rechargeable batteries including mhs 2800, in a few photos are depleted energy and delay in loading the flash. I have read of other users with the same problem and found no solution. I think Amazon know this and so sold them cheap.

Reviews.Title: great camera.
Reviews.Author: Paul A. Saporito
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because I wanted one that took great pictures and video. It does not disappoint. I still haven't learned everything this camera can do but I've taken some great pictures and videos at concerts and events. HD video is clear and playback is easy. Easy to upload pictures to my computer too. I've blown up some of my pictures and the quality is amazing. Love this camera!

Reviews.Title: Power hungry terrible flash camera
Reviews.Author: Dan
Reviews.Content: I believe this is the worst camera I have ever had. This camera has many problems I will just list a few bad ones. 1) power hungry, 2) even with expensive lithium batteries the flash is very slow to charge, 3) The flash is not automatic you must pop it up 4) very hard to get a good picture inside. I recommend you stay away from this poorly designed camera.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: monica sinkule
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  Takes great pics, easy to use, point and click.  I wanted a smaller camera, but not the slim ones.  This fit the bill.

Reviews.Title: Super Picture Quality.
Reviews.Author: Ho dam
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera to replace my M863 Kodak ( because quality of close-up photo of this Kodak is very poor).The quality of this Canon photo is super, clear even small letters. Need for comercial product photo.

Reviews.Title: I would strongly recommend...
Reviews.Author: Kevin B.
Reviews.Content: I followed the guide of another feedback about buying this camera and also getting the Eneloop 2000mAh rechargeable batteries with charger.  Let me just say I'm 100% satisfied. We went to NYC for the first time ever and this camera and one set(2) of batteries(fully charged) lasted me the entire 4 days I was there. I took over 150+ pictures and each turned out flawless, and I am not a person that takes a lot of photos on a normal basis.  This camera is very good, I'd recommend it to anyone, especially to people like me that don't take a lot of pics.  Its easy to understand, takes great pics and also a nice program and cable to retrieve pics from camera and download to computer. A++

Reviews.Title: love it!
Reviews.Author: bj dgo
Reviews.Content: i was looking for a small but quality camera to take hiking, and loved my previous canon powershot  (which was quite dated).  i absolutely love this model!  it's easy to carry, very ergonomic (at least for me!), and takes great pix!  the zoom is wonderful.... although i'm just a recreational photographer, some of the pix i've taken with it could be easily entered in a contest!i would recommend it highly for your amateur, recreational photographer~

Reviews.Title: Lasted 14 months
Reviews.Author: D. Rieselman
Reviews.Content: Camera worked great. At 14 months, it locked up -- froze in the middle of a Hawaiian vacation. I looked into getting it fixed, which was too pricey to be worthwhile. My last digital Canon also locked up at the 24-month mark, meaning I will never buy a Canon again.

Reviews.Title: Very good easy to use, with lots of functionality
Reviews.Author: Jeff Harper
Reviews.Content: Camera is great size to hold very camera like not too small for us old school people who are used to 35mm cameras.  This was a replacement for a 5 year old Kodak.  Great optical zoom capability, always preferred over strictly digital zoom. Uses convenient alkiline AA or spec says can use NiMh rechargeable which I already use around house and I will try next. so no special batteries needed.One warning when looking for a case, Amazon suggested the Case Logic TBC-302 FFP Compact Camera Case when I bought.  This case does not fit the camera the camera alone was to big.  Instead get the Case Logic QPB-202 EVA Molded Flash Camcorder or Medium Zoom Camera Case (Black) this case has space for camera and a pocket for extra batteries and usb cord.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good, but,
Reviews.Author: Earl  Edris
Reviews.Content: I won't buy another camera without a thru viewfinder.  A screen is impossible to see in sunlight.  The pictures are great.

Reviews.Title: Great pictures from this camera.
Reviews.Author: M. Heffington
Reviews.Content: Camera is easy to use and takes great pictures.  Neither my wife nor I are photographers, but we are both complimented continuously for our great pictures.  We take our own pictures of the kids and for Christmas cards and the pictures always look great.  We want to buy another Canon like this one.

Reviews.Title: The WORST
Reviews.Author: MaryO
Reviews.Content: This is the WORST Canon camera I've ever owned. There is no battery life and I have tried all types of batteries including rechargeable. Last night I tried to take a video of the fireworks. Three sets of new batteries and and 1 set of newly recharged batteries in 20 minutes!! What a waste I've had this camera for a year and this isn't the first time this has happened. I'm sorry I ever bought it. I gave 1 star for color. Thank heaven for IPod cameras.

Reviews.Title: Bummer about the Batteries...
Reviews.Author: Angie Rogers
Reviews.Content: I love Canon, but this camera was a bummer! I returned it because the batteries would die so fast that I couldn't even get to know the camera. It was a good price, but not worth all the dying batteries. Camera did have some nice features, but the manual flip up flash was strange also. I didn't like that! Don't waste your time on this one.

Reviews.Title: CONSTANTLY REPLACING BATTERIES
Reviews.Author: Faye "soul survivor"
Reviews.Content: Even given all of the great features and great price, I am still sorely disappointed in this camera.I should have paid more attention to the details of the camera...specifically the fact that it uses 2 AA batteries.Not realizing that it would only take 30 photos before having to change them out, I went through 20 Energizer batteries on about 600 photos. .I then bought 4 NiMn rechargeable batteries and charger. They aren't much better as using Energizer AA ones. only less costly.To reduce the aggravation of changing them out so frequently, I just bought some Energizer Titanium batteries to carry along as extras when the rechargeable ones run out of power. I have yet to see how that works out.I am getting great photos and it has some nice features. and if I wasn't wanting to use it for more than just a few at a time it wouldn't be such a problem.Depending on how this next week goes, if it is not too late, I will be returning it.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: Joseph Gilbo
Reviews.Content: It's a good camera & vey easy to handle.It makes a high quality pictures and it meets my expectations.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Dentaldiva
Reviews.Content: Great price for the camera. Camera came before delivery date. Everything came as specified in the order. Brand new camera, works wonderful. Would definitely purchase again!

Reviews.Title: very good for the price
Reviews.Author: Xiuxiao Jiang
Reviews.Content: It is small, convenient, easy to use and carry, good for travel.Screen is big, but resolution is not high.Screen has a lot of noise in low light ..Battery life is so short...Pictures quality is good .. big lens, 12x good for normal shooting ..Overall to me it is 4 starts

Reviews.Title: Good general purpose camera
Reviews.Author: Just another customer
Reviews.Content: I would prefer an optical view finder, but the LCD display works adequately.  Although the actual image taken by the camera showed a larger area than what was displayed on the LCD.  Other than that, I have no complaints.

Reviews.Title: awesome
Reviews.Author: Anthony
Reviews.Content: very great starter camera, zoom is awesome. works better in the light .. uses aa batteries and need to buy a memory card

Reviews.Title: Great camera!!
Reviews.Author: Ted de Castro
Reviews.Content: With 45x zoom and image stabilization (ABSOLUTELY NECESSARY at that mag) its great - LOTS of megapixels doesn't hurt either.  Its about the same power as a spotting scope I have that yields great views of the Moon - so I took a picture of the Moon - with max gain and the IS it came out great - crystal clear and lots of detail.  I just wish the software were better and that it had a remote trip.  ALL digital cameras seems to have this failing - they really need some sort of cable release or other remote trip and the software should allow full operation of the camera from your computer - after all its not like you NEED any special software just to take pictures from the camera to your computer!

Reviews.Title: work grate
Reviews.Author: dilli ghalley
Reviews.Content: i like it because it work perfect.my all friends and families like the camera.Because it take a picture perfect. Nice and clean.

Reviews.Title: Great camera !
Reviews.Author: Chris L.
Reviews.Content: Great Camera takes great pics.. we love the zoom.. wicked nice zoom.. we took this to our local zoo and got some amazing pics of the animals..

Reviews.Title: PowerHot SX150 IS
Reviews.Author: Rich B
Reviews.Content: I love Cannon products.  This camera is easy to handle and to use. I am somewhat of a beginner in photography and this camera is ideal for me.

Reviews.Title: Had to return
Reviews.Author: DragonzTear
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed with this camera.  When I powered it on for the first time, a white line bisected the display, no matter what mode I was in.  Also, the picture on the display was extremely grainy and distorted.  I had to return it.

Reviews.Title: earlier delivery
Reviews.Author: Franco
Reviews.Content: excelent camera, great pictures and video it's highly recommended.i feel like a proffesional photographer, you can do a lot of changes on the image

Reviews.Title: Extremely Delighted.
Reviews.Author: Michael LaFountaine "Alchemical Design Wizard"
Reviews.Content: I consider this product to be the very best in its class, especially at the current price point (I paid just under 100 U.S. dollars). The image quality is very spot on with little artifacting even when capturing low-light moments. I enjoy all the features as they are very useful & well thought out.The only slight drawback I have found thus far whilst using this camera is the lifespan of alkaline batteries, which is easily remedied by switching to rechargable NiMH types. I purchased an expanded set of NiMH that included eight AA & four AAA including charger for 30 U.S. dollars, ensuring plenty of captured moments, and also saves money on other devices in my collection. [including remote controls & wireless video game controllers, etc.)The full auto setting on this device is worth the admission price alone & even though there is a bit of an initial delay when first using the auto-flash feature, the time becomes quite workable, especially after getting used to it. I enjoy shooting pictures with this camera as it is much more portable than my T3i.I always bring the SX150 IS with me as it certainly makes for a convienent companion to the above mentioned camera. I leave a 75-300mm zoom on the T3i, mounted on a tripod & use the SX150 IS to complement the shooting session & the entire setup can be swapped for even better results. [I shoot mostly musical performing artists].The ease of use, coupled with breath-taking image quality with the ability to easily create prints up to 11x14 for framed wall mountings makes the Canon SX150 IS a must have for everyone, especially those who require prosumer quality without a very steep learning curve. My teenage little ones have quickly learned to enjoy capturing images using this camera & they prefer the ease of use over the 'big boy' DSLR.Enough said. I believe everyone who chooses to buy this product will be quite satisfied with the resulting experience of owning such a quality piece of equipment.Post Script - I have not mentioned the video functionality of this device simply because I prefer using dedicated video cameras whenever shooting movies.

Reviews.Title: T E R R I B L E!!!!
Reviews.Author: Jeni
Reviews.Content: It would be great if it wasn't for the batteries it needs. I will end up spending more money on batteries each week. I took 4 pictures the first day ingot it and the battery died. Spend alittle more on another camera, you would end up spending it on batteries anyway. I returned it, not worth it. Terrible product

Reviews.Title: My husband couldn't be happier
Reviews.Author: Denise R. Holliday "shutterbug"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this as a Valentine's Day gift for my husband.  He's delighted with the camera.  It has features that allow both "out of the box" usage and flexibility for more experienced / adventurous photographers.  It's got big capabilities in a small, easy to bring along package.

Reviews.Title: Awesome value!!!
Reviews.Author: flatseas
Reviews.Content: I am not a professional photographer by any means but this camera rocks!I took it to the Capitol One Citrus Bowl in Orlando and from about 30 rows up I got close-ups of the game that I made 8x12's of for my office. They look incredible.The camera is simple to master and affordable.I bought one for my Dad to finally get him to join the digital revolution and after his initial fear of new things subsided he fell in love with it.For the price you cannot find a better product.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SX 150 is 14.1 PM Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Judith C Trump
Reviews.Content: I loved this camera.  I only had it two months when I lost it.  I found it easy to use and it took excellent pictures.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful photos from a camera that fits yout pocket.
Reviews.Author: Terry B
Reviews.Content: Took this camera to Hawaii last year.  Got some good quality rechargable batteries and shot all day long.  Our friends kept asking what kind of camera we had because the images were so sharp.  The 12X zoom worked beautifully and the image stabilization made up for the lack of tripod in most cases.  I was so pleased that I picked up another for the metallurgical lab at work.  Great macro images as well.

Reviews.Title: Replacing a stolen camera
Reviews.Author: markm
Reviews.Content: This camera was bought to replace an identical stolen camera.  I didn't think twice about which one to buy. Great pictures and portability for an incredible price. Other than the flash that has to be manually raised, this has been a perfect camera for me

Reviews.Title: Great Camera.. not the batteries
Reviews.Author: Malik
Reviews.Content: I purchased it as a gift for my brother. He has not received it yet, but I already tried it when I received it to make sure it is not defected. I like it, I always owned Canon digital cameras, they are the best.I just wished that the batteries are not AA, i like those you can charge.

Reviews.Title: i love this camera
Reviews.Author: Nandrin
Reviews.Content: for the price you can't beat this camera.  takes amazing shots, size fits in your pocket, amazing zoom, nice flash, great 720 hd video.  what else do you need?

Reviews.Title: A lot of camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Gerald Schneir "Jerry SCHNEIR"
Reviews.Content: A very good camera for those who want something more than a simple point and shoot, yet it can act just like a P &S; should you want to.

Reviews.Title: Camara
Reviews.Author: Oscar Ortiz
Reviews.Content: I really love it. For a not so expensive camera. Very good for traveling and it get very nice pictures

Reviews.Title: An excellent point and shoot camera
Reviews.Author: Mark
Reviews.Content: I have been using this camera for about 6 months and I love it!  For the price, it cannot be beat!  It has so many features for taking pictures and the quality is great! It also takes excellent HD video and the audio quality is awesome for a camera like this!  I've used it for several things since I bought it and it's basically paid itself off.Battery life for a point and shoot is probably average.  The more you use it in one setting the quicker the batteries wear out.  I turn it off when I can between pictures.  I also switched to rechargeable batteries and they seem to last a little longer than traditional batteries.

Reviews.Title: Great for close-up product photos
Reviews.Author: Jessica Cook
Reviews.Content: I am by NO means a camera expert. In fact, I find the whole process of shopping for a camera overwhelming. I literally went to Wal-Mart and asked the employee for a recommendation on a camera that would be good for shooting product photos (I sell items online at Etsy and my own site), and she recommended this one because it's the camera they use in-house there for passport and product photos in the store. They didn't have it so I came here to look it up.Right out of the box, this is an upgrade from my last camera, which was also a Canon Powershot. With just the simple click of the macro button I'm getting REALLY crisp, clear photos with fairly awesome true-to-color shades. I only need minor edits from there to get them shop-ready. I also like that on this camera you can manually set the aperture and the white balance, and even though I'm still learning how to do all of that it's good that the camera can grow with me as a photographer. For the price and the simplicity of use, this is a really great camera.

Reviews.Title: Get some Nickel Zinc batteries for this, or you'll get angry with it...
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Great camera, takes good pictures and lasts awhile now on rechargeable batteries now that I found out how to "FEED IT".The biggest problem with this is its "Low Voltage Detection circuitry".  It doesn't "like" NiMh batteries AT ALL... some show up as "dead" in this as soon as you take them off the charger (In other devices, they work fine).  Some will show "weak", and still take a few shots before showing "dead" and the camera refuses to operate.  I then found the batteries had 70-80% of their capacity remaining in them AFTER the camera said they were dead...Same thing with alkaline batteries... when it says they're dead - don't believe it - I can put them right in my old Powershot A720 and take many, many more photos.  This camera just refuses to operate much below 1.25V, which is nominal for a medium-discharged alkaline (under load) or NimH battery.My solution (without actually modifying the camera somehow): NiZn batteries.  I know they may not have the predicted cycle life of NiMh batteries, but they are cheap, and make the camera "happy".  With a freshly charged cell voltage as high as 1.8V, and a "fully discharged" cell voltage of 1.25V - they are honestly "dead" when I remove them from the camera (not just because the camera "says so"), and I can recharge them as often as I like to feed this camera's voracious "appetite" for batteries.

Reviews.Title: Wanted good zoom features
Reviews.Author: Kathy Brown
Reviews.Content: Once I understodd how the camera actually worked -- it has been superb. I took about a dozen batteries along on the seven week trip and had no problem with battery life.

Reviews.Title: Excellent photos
Reviews.Author: Flintstone
Reviews.Content: I've got several cameras from a Canon Rebel to a Kodak - this is the one I use most.  Like so many things these days the size of print for the manual was so small it was hard to read. (I just had my Opthalmologist Surgeon and Optometrist test me at 20/15)  I downloaded it and put it in a font I could read easily because, like most cameras, there are things you need to know.  This is a quick easy to use camera so you don't miss the unexpected shots you want.  Downside is the camera requires AA batteries - Upside is I get a couple hundred shots per set  - I really should buy some rechargeable ones.  Not a professional camera but you can take some shots at a wedding you will be proud of.

Reviews.Title: Good for beginners
Reviews.Author: tengu
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my photography class.I would recommend this camera for those who don't want to get expensive cameras like SLR but want to learn aperture, shutter speed, AMA/ISOThe pictures indeed look different if you change those settings, and this experience will make u want to know more about what those settings are. (At least that's the case for me)For batteries, I used normal batteries and they all died in a day. I bought a rechargeable batteries and they do work really good.Mine broke 3 weeks after the purchase, but canon offers the free repair service and they were pretty nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: Worked great...until it broke
Reviews.Author: ktsreviews
Reviews.Content: I was really happy with this camera.  Great zoom, features, etc.  It really worked great.  But after about 4 months of owning it, it suddenly just shut down, saying it needed new batteries.  When I replaced the batteries, it still said it needed new batteries.  I'm in the process of sending the camera into Canon for repair since it's still under the limited warranty, so we'll have to see how it works once I get it back.  So far, however, I'm disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Very Pleased
Reviews.Author: Kim Emery
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with the camera purchase. Love the pictures.. including the flash pictures. However the battery live is horrid.. Be sure to travel with an extra set so you are not left with regret for missing that "shot of a life time".

Reviews.Title: Great buy!
Reviews.Author: Jeremy
Reviews.Content: Purchased camera for work, takes great photos of highly precision and clarity. Price was great, you wont brake the bank on this one but you will get a good camera.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE IT!!
Reviews.Author: Augusto De Souza Barbosa "Augusto Barbosa"
Reviews.Content: I spent almost a month browsing for the right camera i wanted.. and i was very pleased with this one, so i bought it.. and i'll tell you what, i made the right decision! The camera looks professional, people think i have a $400 dollar camera and i paid less then $120..But what's even better then that is the actual picture quality, the camera has a lot of features that are very easy to find and use... It doesn't take too long to focus on something, and the pictures even with the full zoom(optical+digital) still pretty sharp.There's only a couple of things i don't like on this:  1- If you try to zoom in something that is closer then about 10inches the focus just don't stay clear(even on manual focus)  2- When you're recording and you try to zoom, in some occasions just feels like taking forever to get there.. it zooms very slowlyThose are the only "issues" i have with this.. But they're not big deal to me, and the camera has so many other cool features for it's price that i still giving 5 stars!

Reviews.Title: Clear pictures but burns through batteries
Reviews.Author: Mary Sara Pipia
Reviews.Content: Bought this for a trip to Paris with girlfriends this fall as I didn't want to take my big camera.  Takes okay, clear pictures but burns through the batteries.  Not great night time pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: SandyMom
Reviews.Content: This replaced my old point and shoot camera. I'm still learning about all the functions. Order shipped very quickly, perfect condition. Price was super. Overall very happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Decent camera with some quirks
Reviews.Author: Peter A
Reviews.Content: Did a lot of reading before buying this model. After about 1000 photos, I'm still trying to wring this thing out.  Takes reasonably good quality photos.  However, side by side, I still like the clarity of the photos from my Fujis better.  I prefer to use the Auto mode on my cameras since most do a very good job (kudos to all of the manufacturers).  However, I've noticed that on this Canon, the auto focus frame tends to go find and focus on objects other than those that I'm shooting.  As an example, I was in the hummingbird house at the local zoo.  The camera continually focused on the lightest item in the frame rather than the item in the center.  I found that moving the settings to "Foliage" allowed a little better control of the auto focus.  In some modes (auto is one), the user is not able to force or stop the flash at will.  Found this to be an issue when I saw drastic light changes in areas that shifted from shade to bright light.  If I needed to change the flash setting in Auto mode, I would have to either raise or lower the flash and wait for the flash to charge.  On the Fujis, this can be accomplished by the press of a button.  All in all, a nice camera, but less than I was expecting from Canon.

Reviews.Title: Another winner from Canon
Reviews.Author: M. James
Reviews.Content: I've owned Canon cameras for 20 years. I've had 35mm film format, point and shoot, and DSLR cameras, all by Canon. No, I'm not opposed to other brands! It's just that Canon offers a lot of bang for your buck, and their quality has always been good. I'm not going to give a lengthy critique. I prefer to keep it very simple. I purchased this Powershot to replace an old Powershot that's seen better days (used by myself and two of my now grown children). It's also my alternative camera when I don't feel like lugging around the DSLR (camera, bag, lenses, flash). NO, it's NOT the smallest camera out there! Does it do everything perfectly? Of course not! Some of these reviews will complain about it taking too long to recycle between shots. Well, what do you expect with 14.1mp? If you feel that it takes too long, lower your mp! Unless your blowing up pictures to poster size, you problably don't NEED 14.1mp! This camera delivers good, solid quality pictures...period! That's exactly what I wanted, and, in a package that wouldn't break the bank. Additionally, I like that it uses AA batteries (I use rechargeable). Yes, I'd buy the same camera if I had to do it over again.

Reviews.Title: Love Canon
Reviews.Author: Brooke R. Arrowood
Reviews.Content: Canon products are amazing and this one is no different. Its durable, lightweight, an easy to use. I highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Exactly what i wanted
Reviews.Author: John T. Mcginnis
Reviews.Content: I'm  not a camera person. For years I have been perfectly content with either a phone camera or a $30 point & shoot. I decided that with my future travel plans I needed something better. The SX150 was suggested by a camera/photo buff friend at work. I was skeptical at first, thinking this would be more camera than I neede. It probably is more functionality than I'll ever use, but for point and shoot it really is a perfect balance of easy to use and picture/feature performance. I've only had the SX150 for a month, but I'm very pleased with the camera and would purchase again without hesitation. For me it is the perfect camera when the phone or cheap point and shoot just are not up to the task.

Reviews.Title: Great pictures
Reviews.Author: Diquilter
Reviews.Content: I am an amateur photographer, happy with the quality of the pictures - that I can zoom in or enlarge quite a bit before pixelation starts and ease of use is a huge plus!  I confess that I have not read the "how to" yet, that is available should I want to take advantage of all the things this camera can do.4 stars because there seems to be a slight increase in recovery time between taking pictures, compared to other previously owned/used cameras, especially if using the flash. It could be because the camera does appear to eat battery power rather quickly if you need to have the camera on - power saver shuts the camera off, so I need to turn it back on constantly. I try to remember to have good quality rechargable, (AA size), back-up batteries with me. As long as I have them - no problem!The camera is a little larger than the pocket size point and shoot digital cameras, but feel the quality of the picture and options are worth it.I mostly photograph moving targets ;), quilters who tend to be a little excited during show and tell, so it's a challenge to get photos that are not blurry, that can then be used for our newsletter.  The Cannon Power Shot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera has made that job a little easier for me!

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: noname
Reviews.Content: Purchased this after our 1 yr old Sony CyberShot crapped out.Wanted a very basic camera that USES AA BATTERIES.  Am so tired of lugging a charger around, and then the batteries are unreliable, CyberShot batteries with full charge would sit for 1 month, then when we went to use it, the battery died just sitting in camera.Wanted a camera with cheap, easy to find AA batteries,  also bought rechargeable AA for around the house use.Only Ding to write about is it takes a LLLLLLLLLLLLLLong Time for Flash to charge and recharge.  If your going after fast shots of your kids playing or pets running around, This is NOT the camera for that.  If your outside then its great, if your indoors and everyone is standing still saying Cheese for the third time, then it will be fine.The Zoom is nice and again, the quality of pics is very nice.  so if you dont mind the slow flash time, then you will like this camera.  We do,Can I say again how much I like the fact that it uses AA batteries!wish more cameras would gravitate back to using normal batteries.

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA
Reviews.Author: JPW
Reviews.Content: This is the third SX camera I have owned.  I dropped and broke the first one and lost the second one.  If anything happens to this one, I will replace it with another in the same series.  Picture quality is outstanding.  Inside shots are particularly good.  Great for the grandkids concerts and sporting events.  Love this camera.

Reviews.Title: More I use it the more I like it
Reviews.Author: Sank
Reviews.Content: I'm an experienced amateur photographer. I've had several digital SLR's and Point and Shoots over the years. This camera is fast becoming my goto camera for events when I don't want to carry a big SLR and associated lens. Which, BTW, the more I use the camera, the more events I seem to be leaving the SLR at home.The first few times out I was feeling some buyers remorse. Battery life is awful and the flash is a little sketchy. Takes too long to charge and when charged it's slow. I thought the whole camera was too slow to focus and shoot. When it did shoot the results were great.. but I wound up buy another small point and shoot for quick snaps.Another thing I didn't like is the weight. This camera is a little bulky for a pocket and kind of heavy for the size of it.But I kept playing around, the learning curve is a wee bit steep. But as I've started to figure it it, I'm really more and more impressed.The manual settings are outstanding for what is essentially a point and shoot. Lots of controls on shutter speed and aperture. Speed goes from 1/2500 to 2 minutes or so. Apeture from f3.4 to f8.0, and either or both are adjustable.But my favorite feature is the zoom. Up to 12X with the lens, and 40X digitally. It does get grainy a the higher zoom, but for the size and money, amazing. I took some pictures from row 52 in the corner of Auburn's football stadium and I was more than pleased, even at shots all the way across the field a distance of about 175 yards or so.This isn't really a beginners camera, but with a little study and some practice I think most photographers will be very impressed.And the battery life issue was solved more or less with nicad batteries, I carry a couple spares with me just in case.

Reviews.Title: Great Canon for Price
Reviews.Author: Giorgi
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my girlfriend and she really liked it.First time we had a problems with batteries.Some of them didnt last too long.I advice to any who buy this camera to purchase sanyo enelop or sony 2500 mAh AA Batteries.Thanks!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: rwderham
Reviews.Content: GREAT Camera for the dollar amount. Easy to use, lightweight and takes excellent pictures in several different modes. Looking forward to using this camera more on vacation.

Reviews.Title: Great value
Reviews.Author: mvincze
Reviews.Content: A very good value camera, clear pictures, outstanding video quality in this price range. Only problem is that even better batteries don't last too long.

Reviews.Title: Great stills, inferior video
Reviews.Author: Rick Wise
Reviews.Content: This medium-small camera takes pretty terrific still pictures in all sorts of light. Even with the ISO cranked up to max, the pictures are very usable. Get at least 4 Eneloop AA rechargeable batteries. The Alkalines wear out fast.Pros:--pretty terrific still images--wide end of zoom is not as great as one going to the equivalent of 24mm, but 28mm isn't bad at all--you can easily control depth of field by using the aperture priority mode, and let the camera set the shutter speed -- something I use a lot--equally you can set the shutter speed you want and let the camera pick the iris--full manual control if you want to go there--even full auto mode is quite good--good range of ISO / sensitivity--extreme close-focus at wide end of zoom, which I also use a lot--able to shoot multiple shots just holding down the trigger (set the function to that mode)--auto focus seems to work and track well--rather large zoom range, though I mostly use the camera at the full wide end and adjust the frame by moving closer or farther way.Not so good:--inferior video -- this one is a serious defect, the others not so much--too big to fit in a pocket well -- small but bulky--no way to bracket exposure automatically--limited iris (doesn't open very wide or close down very much)For the price, a terrific little camera.

Reviews.Title: Great for beginner family shots!
Reviews.Author: atobonez
Reviews.Content: I researched several cameras on Black Friday.  I needed something that could take clear shots of my children as well as clear shots while my children played sports.  This camera is easy to use and takes great action photos.  I read several reviews where people complained about the battery life.  If you get lithium batteries, you will get plenty of time before they go out.  I don't use my camera every day, but I am still on the same set of batteries that I put in back in early December.  If you are looking for a good every day camera and a good price, this is your camera.  If you are looking to take pictures of butterflys on flowers, spend the money and go with the more expensive Cannons.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot SX150
Reviews.Author: K
Reviews.Content: This was the first digital camera that I've owned, it was very easy to understand.  The pictures all came out good, very clear.  When downloading them on my computer the instructions were easy to follow and even a nerd like me had no problems at all.  I would recomend this camera to anybody.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershoot SX150 IS
Reviews.Author: Mich
Reviews.Content: I did quite a bit of research before purchasing this camera and two of the downsides about it was that it goes through batteries quickly and that it takes a while to recharge after taking a picture with a flash. But I decided to buy it anyway because it had all the other qualities I was looking for in a digital camera.  And after playing around with it and testing it, the reviews were right on.  But other than that, I love the camera and am enjoying the quality of pictures it does produce.

Reviews.Title: Very Nice Camera for the Price
Reviews.Author: CJon
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for Christmas, and it works very well. I use rechargeable Powerex Imedion Batteries, they have 2400 mAH capacity & have a extended shelf life. The Powerex Imedion batteries seem to work better then the Alkaline batteries they gave with the camera. You can purchase the batteries on Amazon. I would recommend getting the Powerex charger with the batteries for this camera. Over all I would highly recommend this camera it can take very nice pictures even in low light rooms.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: jj
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. It takes great video and photos. It has the great Canon user interface. Well designed. I love that it uses AA batteries. It does eat them up fast, but that doesn't bother me because with AA's I can just have a set of 4 rechargeables and swap them whenever needed.It has really good manual control features. It would be perfect for me if it had a swiveling LCD screen. It takes up to 15 sec exposures, which is good, but I'd like to have longer. The lens and mechanical stuff seem well made for a cheap point and shoot camera.

Reviews.Title: CANON POWER SHOT
Reviews.Author: Sherry A. Cook
Reviews.Content: I purchased the camera because my Kodak doesn't take very good indoor pictures. Even with a flash from 15' away the pictures are dark. This camera DOES take a pretty good picture even from far across a room with a flash, much better than the Kodak does, but pictures are not really QUITE as bright as I'd like them to be. For what the camera cost, though, it's easy to use and the pictures are pretty good.

Reviews.Title: ready out of the box
Reviews.Author: stuffhunter
Reviews.Content: What a great Christmas gift. We had so much fun using this camera right out of the box. All we had to do was put a sd card in it and away we went. The one problem we had is that the batteries that came with the camera didn't last very long. That was no big deal really we just put a couple new ones in and we were back in business.

Reviews.Title: canon sx 150
Reviews.Author: esculap
Reviews.Content: i have bought this camera a month ago.But i already love it! it takes very beautiful photoes! Also it's not expencive! pictures are like real.But i'am amazed becauce this video takes HD videos and they are fine.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: siggy
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased this camera and love it! The zoom is amazing, and it takes great pictures even when zoomed in all the way. Picture quality is fantastic and it is very easy to use. I would reccomend buying a good set of rechargable batteries, I bought a good set and they last forever in the camera. My only complaint is that is takes a while inbetween pictures for the flash to recharge. I would reccomend this camera to anyone whether you are an experienced or new to taking pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Paul0408
Reviews.Content: Great camera for the money. This camera performs better than I expected it to, the features are great and the pictures are even better. It is a super value for the money. If you don't want to spend $600+ on a camera this is the one for you. I highly recommend purchasing 4 rechargeable AA batteries, it takes 2 but burns through batteries pretty quick.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic camera
Reviews.Author: D. A. Hunt
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  It is NOT a pocket size camera, but it does a fantastic job.  The anti-shake seems to work really well, even in low light.  I was at a hockey game the other night and was able to get sharp, clear photos of the opposite end of the ice easily.  It DOES eat batteries, but I invested in Eneloop rechargeable batteries and I am very pleased with it.

Reviews.Title: My experience with the batteries...
Reviews.Author: Kathryn J Szabo
Reviews.Content: Yes, this camera does run the batteries down, but...I have a cheap set of 2000mH nicads, and I just ran about an hour of video and about 40-50 flash pics before the batteries died.  The low battery icon started flashing after maybe 10 minutes of video recording, but then just kept going and going.  When the batteries are really low, it will say 'replace batteries' instead of just having the flashing icon.  So in my opinion this is reasonable battery life for what you get...and the video quality is very good.Meanwhile, it does take several seconds to recharge the flash, which is not an issue unless one wants to take rapid succession flash pics, which most people don't want or need with a point and shoot.It's also nice to have the ability to go shutter priority, aperture priority, or full manual.  I haven't tried taking fast-action shots yet, but am looking forward to trying.  The zoom is impressive at this price point.

Reviews.Title: Canon power shot
Reviews.Author: Almightyeddie
Reviews.Content: This camera is a pretty good camera. The only problem that I had, was me not getting the batteries that were "included". I bought it new, and now I think I got jeffed. But oh well..still a working functional great camera.

Reviews.Title: Great point and shoot camera!
Reviews.Author: emilyd97
Reviews.Content: For a point and shoot camera this takes amazing photos. I'm not a professional photographer by any means, just a high school student who loves photography and needed to be on a budget for a new camera. The effects are great, it's easy to hold, not too heavy, and takes nice photos. The only cons I have are that the flash sometimes takes a little while to charge, the HD photos take up a lot of memory space (so buy a memory card with a lot of space), and it's AA battery powered, which can be costly, but if you buy rechargeable batteries (which most electronic stores as well as target sell) it shouldn't be too much of a problem. Great buy!

Reviews.Title: Value for Money really good
Reviews.Author: DC
Reviews.Content: The value for money is really important, and this camera is cheap in relationship with its functionality! The only "defect" I found is that sometimes, the Flash takes too long to charge and to be able to take another photo.

Reviews.Title: It is a really good camera.
Reviews.Author: Misha
Reviews.Content: This camera is great! It has great picture and video quality. Also it records sound awesomely. Sadly I had to return it because it had a screen defect. Just a tiny little line going down the lens that was noticeable on images. Once I get refunded for the one I bought, I will get a new one not refurbished. As long as you get it new, you shouldn't worry, its a great camera.

Reviews.Title: great product, good price
Reviews.Author: bizyniz
Reviews.Content: This is an updated version of my previous Canon SX130 IS 12.1 MP.  Great Canon quality, good price and delivery from my Amazon seller.  Features are mostly consistent with previous camera, with a new new features.  Both cameras have a nice stury body.  I recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Canon SX150 Camera
Reviews.Author: df35
Reviews.Content: What a great camera. This is our 2nd SX150 as we liked the 1st one so much we decided to each have one. The camera takes excellent photo`s and the video is outstanding.Use Sayno eveloop batteries in this camera as they will give you a whole day of shooting.

Reviews.Title: great camera that takes really good pics
Reviews.Author: G. Cheng
Reviews.Content: this is the best camera i've ever owned.  I have had so many compact cameras that are either hard to hold or hard to focus with.  I'm so glad i purchased this and that it is this beautiful red color.  you really need to get the rechargeable batteries because regular ones drain very quickly.

Reviews.Title: Canon PoserShot SX150
Reviews.Author: Lin
Reviews.Content: I bought the camera a few weeks ago.  I was amazed at how like my Canon SLR it was.  All the features are pretty similar.  I was traveling and didn't want to lug the big camera.  i got some fantastic shots w/ the special settings as well as the regular settings.  I did download the manual and it was worth it to have the info for a few features.  It took a while to get use to not having a view finder.  But the camera has not let me down. The ease of the viewfinder definitely relates to the lighting conditions under which you are shooting.  The other thing I love is the size of the camera and the ease of getting that 12x zoom in on the subject.  I would highly recommend this camera to anyone who just wants some good pics of the family and vacations.

Reviews.Title: Great camera but it EATS batteries!!
Reviews.Author: Charlie
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to take on an overseas backpacking trip where I didn't want to carry my huge Canon 5D DSLR due to its weight and size. The only point-n-shoot camera I have used besides this camera was one of the very first Sony Cybershot cameras back in 2001. I chose this one because it had the best optical zoom (12x) than any of the other Canon PnS cameras I looked at in the same price range. (note: I turn digital zoom off because it is crap on EVERY camera so optical zoom is a huge selling point for me).Let me just say that the size and features of this camera are awesome! It is very light weight and fits into the back pocket of jeans moderately easily (its a little bulky in the pocket but it didn't bother me - there are thinner cameras so if fitting it into a pocket is mandatory and bulkiness will bother you then I don't think I would fully recommend this one). The features of the camera blew me away. I used the automatic settings most of the time (wasn't creating art - just capturing memories) and used the snow and miniature mode a lot. Both modes are awesome and I especially like the miniature mode. Very cool effect!But now the downside... this camera EATS AA batteries. Once you put in a fresh pair of AA batteries, you'll start seeing the low battery indicator flashing on the screen really soon. It really depends on how quickly you take photos to really know how many shots you can take on a single set of batteries. I was touring museums and walking through various cities with it and I would get about 30 to 50 photos before the low battery indicator started flashing on the screen. I am so glad that I took a massive jumbo pack of AA's (36 or 48 pack) or else I would have run out. Not sure if this camera will fit the custom Canon batteries that supposedly last longer than regular batteries. You could buy a bunch of rechargeable batteries but you'll need a lot if you're going to be away from a place where you can charge them frequently.I would recommend getting a similar Canon PnS camera with the same features and modes as this one but with either the custom Canon batteries or one that has better power ratings *IF* you plan on going on extended hikes or to places where carrying additional batteries or recharging batteries is not possible. If you're just going to use this for around the house, in the car, or other casual use then I would recommend it for the features and extended optical zoom alone.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Rae
Reviews.Content: I love this camera, I bought it for my grandma for Christmas, and she loves it. It is easy for her to use, and it takes great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Battery fail
Reviews.Author: Dawn D Wiebe
Reviews.Content: I read tons of reviews on this camera and thought it would be our best best in our budget.  I knew that it ran on AA's but thought we could make it work.  Well we had the camera three weeks and had to put in three different batches of AA's.  That's not in our budget and it just isn't handy to have to switch out batteries in the midst of doing life and trying to capture it.  When a you have an opportunity for a great picture time doesn't stop to change the batteries.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot SX150 IS
Reviews.Author: Mr Ed
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great pictures and has a fantastic zoom.  It also has some great features.  Uses batteries like no tomorrow is the only drawback so far.  I like the bulk of the camera because it has the feel of a SLR.  The 3" LCD makes up for the lack of a viewfinder, but I haven't tested it out fully yet to see if being out in the bright sun will affect the view of the subject.  My previous Canon camera had both the viewfinder and a smaller LCD so I kind of miss that feature.  You also have to physically lift up the flash in order to use it, but the camera tells you if a flash is needed.  Overall a great digital camera.

Reviews.Title: its very good for closeup photos and very bad in night view
Reviews.Author: AmazonUser
Reviews.Content: its very good for closeup photos and very bad in night view, zooming is very nice in terms of image stability. Video quality is also good.

Reviews.Title: A lot of camera for alittle money
Reviews.Author: Judi Beaubien
Reviews.Content: I was a week away from going on Alaskan Cruise when I discovered that my camera wasn't working.  I am not a camera buff and to be honest I don't take a lot of pictues.  A fancy camera was out of the questiuon for me.  After searching out many styles and brands I decided on the Canon PowerShot SX150.  I feel this was an approprate purchase for my needs. It is easy to use and the pictures are clear.  I couldn't be happier with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: nice camera!
Reviews.Author: michael
Reviews.Content: ok, i am not a pro photographer but i do love taking pictures. all of the functions on it seem to be very nice although the battery life is pretty low.  i have only been using this camera for a few days and love the picture quality compared to other cameras that friends have and i thought the pricing was right for it considering even after shipping it was still 15 bucks cheaper than walmart.  I still have a lot to learn about this camera and still have to use every feature to be more helpful to people but so far i love this camera.

Reviews.Title: Excelent!
Reviews.Author: Franklyn Lemus "Franx"
Reviews.Content: I haven't figure all this camera out yet, because it just arrive, but the first impressions are quite positive, great pictures, and it looks that are trouble free, so opposite with the Fujifilm 3200 that came with the flash damage and have to be returned...and last but not least the AMAZON CUSTOMER SERVICE did a fantastic job with that problem and I was able to get this new camera!!!

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for...or less
Reviews.Author: Gladius
Reviews.Content: Great price on a near superzoom.  I like canon P&Ss.;  The size is fine.  Newish model.  Ok specs.Unfortunately, an immediate surprise.  It takes 2 AA batteries.  I broke out two new alkalines just to test and the very first picture wouldn't take.  Instead a message like "Flash needs time tocharge."  On the first picture with new batteries!  This kept happening.  A slow camera to say the least.I played with it a bit (indoors) and noticed only modest blur (good) but a lot of image noise.  A good comparison camera is the Canon Elph 300/310 HS.  It's pics have less noise and and it's much faster.  It has better video (1080 vs 720).  Of course, the Elphs are much smaller.  The Elphs are similarly priced.  The advantage embedded in the SX150? --- of course, the 12x zoom.  This might have some meaning versus the Elph 300 and it's 5x zoom but the 310 has 8x zoom.So, I love Canon but cannot recommend this model.  If you want a real superzoom bite the bullet and try the more expensive SX40 (35x but bigger --- and better).  (I haven't tried the SX260 which is priced between the two and 20x.  (It has GPS which I don't need.)

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SX150
Reviews.Author: mick
Reviews.Content: Great camera so far, pics look clear but have not printed them yet.  Easy to use.  Only drawback is that you have to manually raise the flash.  Easy to forget.

Reviews.Title: Not a simple camera to use
Reviews.Author: LTCJDC "JDC"
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera to replace a previous older Canon Power Shot that we liked. I thought the camera was large enough so that it was easy to hold and would avoid those blurry pictures you get with those very small cameras which are difficult to hold and press the button without moving the camera. This camera is not easy to grip. It is awkward to hold and you had better keep the strap around your wrist or it's going down.  The focus is slow when you push the button down halfway and wait. We get many blurry or dark pictures which have to be deleted. The flip-up flash is confusing because the camera doesn't inform you that the light is too low, so you're on your own judging whether the light is sufficient. I would not buy this camera if you need a simple larger reliable camera.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Roger Ramjet "bluescratch"
Reviews.Content: The Canon SX150 is a fine digital camera and at the price of around 150 is a steal and since I used some credit card points I got it for free and that just can't be topped. It's my second digital camera after my Kodak C123 Sport,which is fine also but no zoom.I used the Canon during New Year's Eve and got some great pics. My knowledg of photography is from the bad old days of 110 film in a Kodak Instmatic which needs light or flash and always take 2 pics incase you messed up. The fact the Canon is capable of night pics without flash is great. It does tell me to put up the flash, but I don't. The main reason I got this camera is to play with manual controls and zoom. It could be a bridge camera to an SDLR in a year as I learn more about photography, but I am so pleased with the pics I get that I may just stay with what I have.

Reviews.Title: Battery Life
Reviews.Author: R
Reviews.Content: I've read reviews concerning the short battery life(rechargeable NiMH) for this camera - wow! crappy is an understatement, I'm getting about 50 pics per charge. Other than the battery issue this is a nice camera with lots of shooting options. Sharp pictures,flexibility of fully automatic to full manual mode are the main reasons I bought this. Average rating due to battery life.

Reviews.Title: Very nice for price
Reviews.Author: LadyLikeBearah
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research after the LCD screen broke on my Nikon Coolpix (my fault...I dropped it and found it the next day when my family went apple picking.  It was completely intact minus the LCD screen).  This wasn't one of the cameras on my list when I went to a store to see & try out the various cameras I was going to choose from.  I saw this and fell in love.  I was looking for a decently easy-to-use point and shoot camera with a good zoom and my price limit was $200.  This delivered in every way - not to mention all the extra fun scenes and effects.  I like the fact that it uses AA batteries because then I can just have a decently inexpensive backup - and if I lose them or forget them, I can go to any store and get my camera working without having to wait for it to charge.  My last camera used AAs as well, so I had some extra lithium batteries.  I might try rechargeable batteries once my lithium batteries are used up since other reviewers have mentioned they work really well.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Gonts
Reviews.Content: I have bought this camera recently and this light weight camera has surprised me with the quality of pictures. I did knew before buying this that the shutter speed is a bit slower compared to others but the price is unbeatable for such a camera. I also have a cybershot from sony and this fares better than that for sure. I m not a technical guy who would explore all possible pros and cons but would definitely need quality pictures and should fit my budget.Great buy it is!!. Amazon should make sure prices dont fluctuate so heavily else people would start buying it from stores like walmart where its easy to return and buy the same product at a lesser price. Returns with amazon include shipping which is not worth teh pain of packaging and returning when there is a price drop of 20-25 dollars. I got it close to the lowest though but feel sorry for those who had to buy it at 180 $ and hav to see it fall till 145. I myself have cancelled this item before i bought it again at a lesser price. But my buying experience was like catching a falling stock in stock market.Buy - cancel - wait for fall - wait if it falls more - buy again - but still wonder if it will fall more. I dont want my shopping to be anxious.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera at a great price
Reviews.Author: Mike Eldridge
Reviews.Content: I picked this up for my wife when it was on sale. It is a great camera and more than she needs really.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Student Camera
Reviews.Author: William Settle
Reviews.Content: This camera works great and has all the features that I needed for my photography class. Since it is a Digital SLR camera you will be able to manipulate your images as needed for your class, (Shutter speed, ISO and so on). It also has a great and easy to use interface with a great lcd in the back. There is also a dedicated video button, so yes, it can do video. The best thing about this camera though is its price. This by far was the cheapest Digital SLR that I found and it ended up working out great.The one negative that I will say about this camera is that it eats through AA batteries fast. If you get this, go ahead and get some rechargeable batteries too. You will be happy you did.

Reviews.Title: Red Canon Camera
Reviews.Author: NANA
Reviews.Content: I love the camera. The ease of use is terrific. Takes great pictures. Have had no problems with the camera since I purchased it.

Reviews.Title: Do not buy this camera if you want to use it for close-ups of jewelry
Reviews.Author: Sasha Crow
Reviews.Content: A friend has this camera and she uses it primarily to take (great, I must say) outdoor shots. I had camera-envy. I needed a camera to take indoor very close-up shots of my jewelry. This cam has macro setting as well as for shooting in tungsten lighting. "Great!" I thought -- WRONG.The macro does not focus when close-in enough to see the detail of a piece of jewelry. I do not want both pairs of earrings at a fair distance. I want to go close-in and show my customers the fine detail that's the result of my technique.Just as bad or worse -- even with two lamps nearly touching the jewelry and the color of the stones showing beautifully bright and vibrant to my eye, deep colors are reduced to black - with a tad hint of tint (sorta).This camera is worthless to me.  It might be the best camera in the world if you are shooting at usual range but for indoor close-ups, it's worthless

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: wilson melo
Reviews.Content: Nice little digital camera. Not so big and with all the functions (auto, manual, etc..) Not pop-up flash as I wanted.

Reviews.Title: Good for 2 years
Reviews.Author: Jim Lively
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera about 2 years ago and found it to be a great camera, but after 2 years it started going downhill. The auto-focus is going out and it is starting to eat up batteries like never before. I am sorry to see it go, as it took great pics and videos. I used it for everything and used my regular video camera as backup only. Guess it just got old. It was great while it lasted. Now, I'm shopping for a newer model Canon. So, if you want a really good, affordable camera for about 2 years, this is your camera.

Reviews.Title: Canon SX150
Reviews.Author: The Durango Kids
Reviews.Content: This camera is amazing. It has worked perfectly. Close ups or distance. Always clear and sharp. Have only used the movie once. Looked sharp as well. I would highly recommend this camera. Especially Amazon's price. Don't know how they do it.

Reviews.Title: Great camera - great price!
Reviews.Author: Miz V
Reviews.Content: I bought this when it was on sale. I was looking for a camera I could afford with easy to understand features. This camera takes great videos and pics. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Consider this camera only if you don't take more than a few pictures at a time
Reviews.Author: Stephout
Reviews.Content: I received this as a gift from my husband.  I tried out a few pictures and it seemed great.  We took it on our trip to Disney World and I did get some good pictures, though I did have to change batteries toward the end of the day if I had taken a lot of photos. I had no issues with the quality of picture, especially since I am not a great photographer.  However, after that trip I found that I was unable to take more than about 20-30 pictures, even with no flash, and the battery would be dying.  This happened on our next vacation and I was very upset because I was stuck with using my phone after I burned through 2 sets of batteries in one day.  I thought that perhaps it was the batteries I had with me, maybe they were old.  So I went out and bought new rechargeable batteries and I had the same problem.  I also tried some non-rechargeable ones with the same problem.Because I usually take pictures just on vacations, I discovered this problem too late for any sort of warranty claim.  I am extremely disappointed with this purchase and feel awful that my husband wasted money on this camera.  I doubt we will purchase another Canon.

Reviews.Title: perfect for me
Reviews.Author: Maryann May
Reviews.Content: my previous cannon powershot had finally died. this newer model is awesome. i carry my camera around all the time, i like the amount of zoom and pixels for such a portable camera and the viewer is large enough for my aging eyes to see what i'm taking pictures of!

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot SX150
Reviews.Author: T. J. Morrow
Reviews.Content: We upgraded from an Olympus that we had used for years.  This camera gave us better MP digital clarity and works well with the 12x zoom.  We use it to take photos of scenes to paint in oils.  We download the computer card to our computer so that we can crop and edit our photos.  We also purchased a larger computer card so that we never have to worry about running out of space when we are taking photos.  We can highly recommend the camera.

Reviews.Title: Functioned poorly.
Reviews.Author: ryter
Reviews.Content: While the photos were beautiful, the camera had malfunction reading battery life. Would stop working & showed new batteries, of all types, as dead, even when fresh batteries were installed. Lithium & rechargeable batteries made no improvement. Camera was  repaired under warranty but new one often wouldn't even turn on & kept shutting off.  Technician kept suggesting I only use preset options as to not waste battery life but that wasn't the issue. The problem was in the battery sensor reading. Repaired camera only honored a 60 day warranty when I had 4 months left on initial purchase. Easy settings & features were offset by the basic camera operation not working at most of the times of use. Size is small enough to fit in an average jacket pockets. Screen size is adequate & allowed reading in bright sunlight. Can store pics on memory card and some on the camera itself.

Reviews.Title: 2nd one
Reviews.Author: Evc "Happy Gramma"
Reviews.Content: We had one like this for two years and loved it. Someone took it while we were at Disney World on our last day. Certainly didn't mind replacing the camera. Just missed our pictures from 4 weeks of vacation. LOVE the fact that you can use regular batteries. Sometimes (like at Philmont) you can't charge anything. You can always AA get batteries.

Reviews.Title: Durable, but has annoying tendancies
Reviews.Author: missmouse7
Reviews.Content: Even though it would insist the batteries were low when I just changed them, I fin this to be this camera's only flaw.This camera has been dropped many times, surviving each drop with no more than a scratch. Other cameras I had did not survive similar falls.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera; Bad Battery Life
Reviews.Author: Ayla Skye Raye-Leonard
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. It's a great weight and size, has amazing zoom, and great specific settings. On a whim decision, I decided to take this to a concert with me, and it was probably the best thing I could have brought. The concert setting was amazing, and in combination with the zoom, it was like I was right in the front row! I've also brought this to a variety of different settings; a trip to Chicago, hang outs with friends, and lots of sporting events. In all of these instances, it preforms to hold up the name of Canon. The ONLY issue I have with this camera is the battery life. It uses up batteries like crazy, so I would definitely pack an extra 2-3 sets of batteries if you'll be using this for more than 2 hours at a time. 6 batteries lasted me through about 5 hours of constant camera use. Overall, this is an amazing camera, and I would highly recommend this to anyone else that is looking for a high quality camera, without spending the price of a professional camera.

Reviews.Title: great little camera
Reviews.Author: Patricia Hayman
Reviews.Content: I wanted a new camera that I did not need to plug in to recharge, it fits. ready to take pictures at the next wedding I will be going to. Love it

Reviews.Title: Decent camera
Reviews.Author: Steve C.
Reviews.Content: It takes pretty good pictures, but the flash is really slow to charge, and I've missed lots of great kid shots because I was waiting for it to charge between flashes.  Also, this thing eats batteries like nothing I've ever owned--you only get about 30-40 shots and the low battery light comes on (it's...crazy fast).

Reviews.Title: Don't waste your money
Reviews.Author: cloudance
Reviews.Content: Not only is the battery life a deal spoiler (as noted all over the place)  the digital noise is unacceptable.  Shame on Canon, they must know they lose customers when they make this kind of c*ap (if there was a 0 star, id rated it as such)

Reviews.Title: Takes great
Reviews.Author: Elin
Reviews.Content: This camera is easy to use and takes great pictures and videos.  The flash is convenient and the directions for use where clear

Reviews.Title: Superb quality photos, but eats batteries
Reviews.Author: Laura A. Palka "lauraannp"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera, especially since it is very intuitive for folks like me who don't know anything about picture taking. I use it in my online business to take product photos and they come out looking unbelievable. Most of the items I sell are rather small, and it is amazing the amount of detail I get with this camera. I find that using natural light works beautifully. The only thing I absolutely hate about this camera is that it uses AA batteries (two total), and it goes through them like candy. I even purchased rechargeable batteries + charger, and I can only take photos for 5 minutes or so before I have to recharge. But I haven't replaced the camera yet because otherwise I love it so much. Oh...and the software that comes with it is really simple and easy to work with, too!

Reviews.Title: a bit clumsy & had a defective part
Reviews.Author: pixel
Reviews.Content: I got the camera primarily because of the zoom factor.  It can really pull distant objects into sharp focus.  It must be held very steady or be braced or placed on a tripod to use the extreme zoom, though.  It takes beautiful photos, but is slow, so if you are shooting anything that moves, you must plan ahead and adjust for the slow capture.  It eats batteries so you must carry plenty of extras.  The most disappointing thing was that my camera will not connect to a computer to download images - the port is defective.  Canon offered to fix it if I sent it in to them, but it would take a long time.  I ended up buying a card reader and now must remove the memory card from the camera and put it in the reader to download images.  It is not ideal, but does work.  If I had a chance to buy this camera again, I would probably not do it.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Forrest D. Rees
Reviews.Content: 5 Star great Camera Great serviceLight weight bright screen Just a great point and shoot camera with lots of extras.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: jimmon
Reviews.Content: Great camera. I use rechargeable batteries and I can't find a charger pack for the camera. so I charge them seperately.That's my only complaint otherwise it takes really good pic's and the zoom if terriffic.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Xjerzgirl
Reviews.Content: I love my camera. The only thing I am disappointed in  is that it takes a while to snap pictures sometimes. The flash takes a while to recharge. I have missed several good shots because of this

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: KSArnold
Reviews.Content: This camera is an older model but takes fine pictures.  It has enough modes that anyone should be able to find a way to take pictures their way.  12x zoom should be enough for most close ups.  AA batteries means power is always close by.  A winner of a camera especially if you can get a good price like I did.

Reviews.Title: Good little camera
Reviews.Author: tvgirl
Reviews.Content: I love Canon products. This camera didn't disappoint either. My only issue is the flash takes forever. Other than that, I would definitely purchase it again for the price and quality of the pictures.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Justin
Reviews.Content: One of the best cameras made.  I only buy cannon cameras.  Always takes a perfect picture...easy to use and loaded with nice features.  If you want a great picture and don't want a complicated machine...get this.

Reviews.Title: Inexpensive Versatile Camera with a Few Flaws
Reviews.Author: Biker395
Reviews.Content: The strengths and weaknesses of this camera are a product of the design decision to power it with AA batteries.  AA batteries are larger, lower voltage, and hold less charge than the specially designed rechargeable batteries used in most cameras.  However, they have the advantage of being easily replaceable by batteries available almost anywhere.So, if you want a camera for mostly outdoor use and you want it to run on AA batteries, this camera deserves serious consideration, especially for the price.  If you want your camera for mostly indoor use and don't care if it uses AA batteries or not, there are better choices.Strengths:1.  As mentioned above, it takes AA batteries.2.  It is inexpensive, so if dropped, no big loss.3.  Unlike almost all other AA battery cameras, it has a full assortment of exposure modes that a competent photographer requires.  Auto, Programmed, Shutter Priority, Aperture Priority, and Manual.4.  At 80 ISO the sensor noise is reasonable and the lens quality is more than good. High quality images are possible if you know what you're doing.5.  While not terribly compact or light (a product of the AA battery format), the camera has rounded curves and is still pocketable.6.  The photo stabilization system is very, very effective.7.  It has a reasonably long zoom (12x).Weaknesses:1.  Since it runs on 2 AA batteries (3V), the flash takes a long time to charge and is weak.  On the bright side, the flip up design reduces red eye, and you can adjust the flash intensity as desired.2.  The sensor is noisy at anything above ISO 200 ... very noisy.3.  The response time is slow.4.  Mine has noticeable vignetting at long focal lengths.

Reviews.Title: Not good for close-ups
Reviews.Author: R. Hatfield
Reviews.Content: I really needed a camera that could take clear pictures of close-up objects (macro focus). For some reason I thought this camera could do that. Boy was I wrong. Nothing is in focus if it's closer than 6 feet. And it eats batteries just like the other reviewers have mentioned. However, it does a good job of taking scenic photos and the optical zoom works well.

Reviews.Title: even with the issues not too bad of a camera
Reviews.Author: Mchael Robinson
Reviews.Content: Bought it for my wife as a starter camera since she wanted to go into photography as a hobby. picture quality doesn't end up too bad if you are patient and acknowledge the cameras limitations (slower flash charging some issues with moving photo subjects). I like the fact that you flip the flash up when you need to use it as well. In regards to its battery life, a decent charger and some  NiMH 2800mAh Rechargable Batteries for 12 dollars altogether eliminated that issue for the most part, we can get pictures for a whole weekend of fun when we go on trips without having to change the batteries but maybe once near the end. Altogether, for the 50 dollars I ended up spending on the camera I have no complaints really. Timely delivery no issues

Reviews.Title: Not as good as expected.
Reviews.Author: Peggy T. Barfield
Reviews.Content: The Canon is a pretty good camera but it does not take pictures that turn out as well as the Kodak Easy Share that I owned. It does take pretty good videos. Too bad Kodak no longer backs up their software.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: Satisfieddiva
Reviews.Content: Not what I expected. I thought just because it was a version newer than my friend that maybe it would be a better camera but that was not the case. It didn't have the motion detection on it; I so wanted that feature.

Reviews.Title: Long battery life and beautiful pictures
Reviews.Author: James A. P.
Reviews.Content: I use it with rechargeable batteries, long life between charges, beautiful pix, love the 12x optics for close-ups,  Very easy and quick to zoom in on subjects.

Reviews.Title: Very convenient
Reviews.Author: Sheralee
Reviews.Content: Very convenient when traveling places without outlets, just carry extra aa batteries. Great pictures, nighttime or dark conditions not so good...grainy. Maybe a better photographer could do better.

Reviews.Title: Perfect gift
Reviews.Author: R. L. Patrin
Reviews.Content: I needed a substantial camera with easy to use functions. Finding this at a deep discount with lots of features was perfect.

Reviews.Title: WOW TALK ABOUT SUCKING THE LIFE OUT TO A BATTERY!
Reviews.Author: Toni Oravez
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great pictures I like it but it goes through batteries FAST! I have spent more on batteries since I bought it then I did the camera easily. Also the flash takes a long time to charge up so it is easy to miss the perfect shot.
