However you know when it is on because you have to manually flip it up, making it easier to not accidently take pictures of gallery subject matter that restricts the use of a flash.  I think I will figure out the features eventually as with all electronics instructions leave unanswered questions.

Reviews.Title: Item was received promptly and packaged appropriately.
Reviews.Author: g.joiner
Reviews.Content: I love this camera so much that we bought another one for my grandson. It takes great pictures. You really need to use industrial strength batteries. Great buy.

Reviews.Title: Over-all a Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: Horsedogcat
Reviews.Content: Great little camera...love it. The only downside is that it does have a high AA battery usage. I like the convenience of being able to use AA batteries, but I always have a couple in my pocket or pack because it always seems to need fresh batteries when I most want to get some photos. Otherwise, it is a solid camera for the money.

Reviews.Title: My Favorite Little Camera
Reviews.Author: AB
Reviews.Content: This is the handiest little camera I've ever owned, and the photos are fabulous in terms of light, color, etc. I travel internationally a lot, and being able to use AA batteries to power the camera is so much easier and convenient than having to hunt for electricity that matches a plug-in. Fits in my belly bag and a big pocket...get one! Great value!

Reviews.Title: Hard on Batteries
Reviews.Author: Dennis
Reviews.Content: We have had this camera for several years. It eats batteries! When I called Canon to complain they just told me to use Energizer Batteries. That was BS. I went on Amazon and bought a Maxell charger and 4 Ni-MH batteries. We also take the batteries out when not in use. This solved our problem. Why didn't Canon tell me this?? We went through a lot of AA batteries before we figured this out. The camera is hard to set the settings for if it were not for the "heart" setting. Just set this and the camera does the rest. It does take great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Good, solid camera.
Reviews.Author: jfb
Reviews.Content: I bought five of these to use taking field pictures in Construction.  They work well.  I had to send two back for exchange because they would kill the batteries quickly, but the replacements work fine.  Among the reasons I chose this camera for this type of photography:1.  Size is good - not so small that you can't operate it with gloves on, and not so big it won't fit in a pocket;2. Uses AA batteries - we use rechargeable Sanyo Eneloops.  Other cameras with proprietary batteries need chargers nearby, etc.  With AA, just throw a spare set in your pocket.3.  SD card - getting an 8GB card is cheap these days and we can carry a spare that fits all our cameras.4.  Standardized controls.  We have been using these Canon cameras for many years and if you know how to use one, you know how to use them all.  We use the date/time stamp feature and standardize the time settings across all cameras so photos from multiple cameras will have consistent time stamps.

Reviews.Title: nice camera
Reviews.Author: a
Reviews.Content: Works great. It is smaller in size than I expected.Looks and feels cheap also. It doesn't come with any memory. So be sure to order memory at the same time.

Reviews.Title: Great, Love it!
Reviews.Author: Grace Hurst
Reviews.Content: I got this one and  I love it. I took it to New Mexico and it worked fine, and where I live it's really humid and I haven't had a problem.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot Camera is Okay
Reviews.Author: Flopsy
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great pictures, however, you have to change the double A batteries every half hour.  It doesn't have a rechargeable battery pack like other cameras.  You would need to be a rechargeable battery pack so you don't waste money.Camera is also a little heavy for a compact camera.

Reviews.Title: Not great, especially for photographing kids/babies.
Reviews.Author: B. Udell "Noodles"
Reviews.Content: We had our first child in the Spring of 2012, and in anticipation I bought a new camera to capture all of the special moments.  I did a decent amount a research and landed on getting this camera, big mistake.It takes forever to snap pictures between shots, the flash takes a lot time to charge.  The auto setting would get us blurry pictures more often then not, so I began using the manual settings.  Did a ton of research on shutter speed, aperture, etc to try to find the sweet spot. I tweaked and tweaked and tweaked the settings, to no avail.  I'm not a professional photographer, but I'm no dummy either, with the amount of time and effort I put into this, you would think I could get some semi-decent shots.The result, 1 out of every 10 pictures snapped was even remotely salvageable.  So many great Kodak moments lost during my baby's first year and a half.  Now I'm already shopping for something to replace this oversized piece of junk.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Keith Rademacher
Reviews.Content: Does everything well, is easy to use, and give outstanding photos.  uses common AA batteries and SD chip with no custom software required.

Reviews.Title: Some issues
Reviews.Author: onthebay
Reviews.Content: Worked well for two months, now occasionally when I push the ON button, the LCD screen won't light with the scene and/or I get an error message to change the batteries (even after I put in fresh batteries).  It hasn't completely failed yet and it's still under warranty, but I expect it to go in for repair when I need it most......say around Christmas.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: MG
Reviews.Content: Great camera More than I expected. the only thing I dont like aboutThis camera isits not an action camera. I can't take a picture of grandsonsliding into home base.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Antony Scully "scullman"
Reviews.Content: Bought three of these to teach an introduction to photography class. Great entry level cameras with decent zoom, Av, Tv, and even manual modes.Good value!

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Rachelle Marie
Reviews.Content: An amazing camera for the price.  Everything works perfectly.  Everything comes out super clear.  So glad I bought this.  I would highly recommend this to anyone needing a camera that could pass as professional quality for a cheaper price.

Reviews.Title: So much joy!
Reviews.Author: Zhanna
Reviews.Content: Great buy at this price! This camera have a beautiful design, compact and comfortable to use! Zoom is good quality for that camera. Using it during 4 years - It is still like new and never had any problem whith it. Very reliable like expensive Canon Cameras.

Reviews.Title: Not Canon Quality
Reviews.Author: sam-i-am
Reviews.Content: Disappointed in this camera and myself for waiting too long to return it. The image stabilization doesn't work anywhere near as well as my older Canon 720IS. It's also a hassle to remember to lift the flash then you have to wait for it to charge. Tonight I took some photos then realized it set itself down to 640x480 size.

Reviews.Title: excellent
Reviews.Author: Orlando Monsalve
Reviews.Content: very pleased really excellent product I can recommend it met my expectations so well that I was really very happy thank you

Reviews.Title: Good mass purchase
Reviews.Author: JC Companies, Inc "James Ray"
Reviews.Content: Company shipped quickly and had no issues with the cameras.  I used this to teach a school photography class with and they abuse them and they continue to work.

Reviews.Title: Okay camera but very bulky.
Reviews.Author: Kelly D.
Reviews.Content: This is an okay point and shoot camera for your family but it is way too big and fat!  I love a camera that can fit in my front pocket while I am running around with my kids, watching sports, and exploring and this is NOT the one for that.  For the size, it should be taking much higher quality pictures.

Reviews.Title: I just got mine too, but....
Reviews.Author: mommyA
Reviews.Content: My husband bought me this camera and I do like it, but I have a little complain about the life of the battery. If you use the regular AA batteries, this camera really eats up the life out of our battery pretty quick. The way to do it is to buy rechargeable batteries and I am going to order some. It also takes a while to charge the flash of the camera so there are times I miss some good shots. Other than that, I like the quality of the photos and the videos that this camera take. Also, the microphone is located on the top left of the camera where your finger goes to hold the camera. Sometimes I would forget that it is there and you end up covering it with your finger when taking your shot. So be aware always that the microphone is on that side or else you would end up like my husband taking a video and couldn't hear himself because he forgot to take his finger off of the microphone. Bad place for it.

Reviews.Title: Broke Shortly After Receiving It.
Reviews.Author: Paul Hoxie
Reviews.Content: When the camera came looked okay but after a couple of usage it showed a Lens Error and would shut down. I think this camera had this issue before and was sent out like this.

Reviews.Title: Great camera.
Reviews.Author: Linda Brill
Reviews.Content: This is the second one I have bought. Bought one as a gift for my brother. The only complaint I have is that the batteries could last longer. Have to keep a couple of spares. with me at all times.

Reviews.Title: Nice
Reviews.Author: Cori
Reviews.Content: I like this camera a lot especially since I don't have a nice phone to take pictures with. The picture quality looks awful when you take the picture but then when you go back and look at it, it looks really nice. It came with the cable to upload the pictures and an SD card but I replaced it with one that had more memory.It also came with CDs that I haven't bothered with. The only downfall is that it does require batteries and they die SO fast.Overall, I really like it.

Reviews.Title: Canon Power Shot SX150 is 14.1MP Digaltal Camera with 12xWide -Angle Optical
Reviews.Author: beverlykeogan
Reviews.Content: Camera is very easy to use.  Pictures are great  Condensed information on the operating of the camera is very good.  I use it mostly to take pictures of family activities and all who see it are well pleased as I pass along copies of the picture. Great buy for the price.

Reviews.Title: canon powershot sx150
Reviews.Author: JOHN B
Reviews.Content: i have already tried the unit but not as much as to provide a more substantial feedback.i took quite a number of shots though, just for purposes of testing and so far i found it meeting my expectations i.e. easy to operate, handy, quick to synch to my laptop and its features like zooming, display, manipulating from auto, portrait etc. are quite nice.one thing i like as a hobbyist is the fact that i do not have to worry about charging the battery when traveling sincei can easily buy alkaline battery anywhere. and that suits my purpose.i will get back when i have fully exhausted its capability :)

Reviews.Title: Good quality photos for a point-and-shoot camera
Reviews.Author: aj
Reviews.Content: - Not recommended to use in low-light- Great for outdoors- Most liked features: 12x Optical Zoom, creative filters- Dislike: Lacks panorama

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: lawrence
Reviews.Content: Nice camera easy to use takes good pictures has all the buttons of and much more expensive camera bright red in color easy to find

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: maddog 11
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera. I purchased this after previously buying an SX130 two years ago. Both cameras are excellent. Takes great pictures and easy to use. Easy to download to computer.Five stars.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SX 150 is
Reviews.Author: Jean P Brittain
Reviews.Content: This camera is very easy to use for a beginner and it takes great pictures.  I could not be more pleased with the use of the camera or with the quality of the pictures taken with this camera.  The manual for it is very easy to read, understand, and to follow the directions.  Best thing going for a person who knows nothing about cameras or taking family pictures.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Ann M. Berka "retired08"
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for several months now and love it.  Takes excellent pictures and 30x telephoto works great.

Reviews.Title: Great Images
Reviews.Author: RustyRoads
Reviews.Content: I have other large Canon cameras. This is a good size for my big hands. Still small enough to be easy to carry.

Reviews.Title: Good camera 4 the money!
Reviews.Author: Kathleen
Reviews.Content: This was a gift for my daughter,who asked for this specific camera.We are Very pleased with it! Its of good quality!

Reviews.Title: Really good in low light
Reviews.Author: Denise Robinson
Reviews.Content: This camera is quite good for the price.  It is substantial, yet small enough to fit in a purse or fanny pack (might be a bit big for a pocket.)  The zoom is easy to use and has several increments between minimum and maximum.  This model works well in low light situations without the flash.  The flash is much better than my smaller Kodak which seemed to be useless beyond 5 feet.  The only thing I can complain about is that the shutter button seems to have a slight delay.  I've gotten used to it, but I found it very annoying at first.  I haven't used the video feature except by accident - it works fine.  The screen on back is nice and big.  I would recommend this as a versatile inexpensive camera with some excellent features.  If I lose it, I will get another just like it.

Reviews.Title: Very good camera.
Reviews.Author: Tony
Reviews.Content: I took it on a trip I went on and for only 2 AA batteries, it last the whole trip. I used the camera everyday and never filled the memory card or had to change batteries. The zoom feature is awesome.

Reviews.Title: Great...except for the batteries.....
Reviews.Author: Cheryl
Reviews.Content: This camera would be great...except for the batteries. Like others have mentioned, this camera sucks 'em dry VERY fast. I just went to a concert a couple days ago, it was 2 1/2 hours long, i went through 6 batteries and i didn't even get that many pictures. I did video as well, but it seemed like i had to change the batteries about every 20 minutes or so, VERY frustrating. Not sure i even want to keep the camera anymore. Thought the fact that it used AA batteries would be good b/c i didn't have to worry about having an extra rechargable battery, i could just bring some spare AA's. Nope. Disappointed, as i am a Canon fan.

Reviews.Title: It takes great pictures
Reviews.Author: Merry Homm
Reviews.Content: My previous camera just wore out from the use, and eventually the lens would not extend to take pictures.I was delighted to find this newer model of the one I'd been using. It has slightly improved features (more zoomcapability and higher megapixel count). It feels lighter than my previous camera, but still takes the same greatpictures.

Reviews.Title: nice camera
Reviews.Author: sportsmom
Reviews.Content: We are very happy with the purchase of this camera.  Good Quality pictures, but easy to use with enough different settings.

Reviews.Title: great for the price
Reviews.Author: dave baker
Reviews.Content: Great for  for the price I bought rechargeable batteries  they seem to last ok.it is a little difficult to get set up for some of the features that do not have a setting on the dial like action fast frame shots if a deer jumps up and you a set for auto you don't have time to change settings still it gives good photos a for my use

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: Dennis "Details"
Reviews.Content: I bought this SX150 for a standby camera, I already own one and it is so impressive I bought a second one for standby in the event the first one fails for some uncontrollable reason.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: gma "photo kathy"
Reviews.Content: This is a nice camera for the money. Wish the flash came up on its own but it takes great pics

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Tina Pahls
Reviews.Content: a great camera and definitely worth the money I recommend buying the rechargeable batteries. Takes great indoor and outdoor photos.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: danna creed
Reviews.Content: i love it and its everything i want in a camerai have n\been taking pics with it every since i got it

Reviews.Title: yep its a camara
Reviews.Author: Doc
Reviews.Content: good pictures light weight good ergonomics good features for the money for a low end camara would recomend works as advertised

Reviews.Title: ease of usage
Reviews.Author: joseph f brayton jr
Reviews.Content: I miss having a viewfinder as i had with previous canon camera.Instructions on flash stated push up flash but i could not do @ a party.The next day ,i found out flash cover flips up,kind of tricky

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: dejaic28
Reviews.Content: I have taken great pictures with this camera. It was a very good buy, I believe I will probably have this camera a long time.

Reviews.Title: Love it!!!
Reviews.Author: Kerri Rudenick
Reviews.Content: So easy to use and quality of picture is great! This was a gift but I picked out and it was worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, Great Price
Reviews.Author: M.Lajoie
Reviews.Content: I love my Canon Powershot.  It's small enough to come anywhere I want to take it, and it takes super photo's.  I also own a Canon SLR camera, can't go wrong with Cannon.

Reviews.Title: excelent machine
Reviews.Author: Jose Manuel Dominguez
Reviews.Content: I chose this rate because I like the product canon power shot, is reliable and is a good productis a good machine,recomendation a my family and frents

Reviews.Title: New Camera
Reviews.Author: avid reader
Reviews.Content: So far the pictures look great.  I haven't used it very much yet.  It does seem like it will be a good camera.  I do wish it had a rechargeable battery.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera
Reviews.Author: Kristine Cross
Reviews.Content: Would recommend to anyone. We actually have bought two cameras- one for us and for a family member. We have no complaints. Shipment came extremely quick. thanks.

Reviews.Title: good gift
Reviews.Author: stephanie vigil
Reviews.Content: I got this as a gift for my aunty since hers broke. She loved it! She says it works better than the more expensive one that she had.

Reviews.Title: Not as good as it might seem
Reviews.Author: brted
Reviews.Content: I used a Canon PowerShot SX100IS for several years before I lost it. I liked the zoom and resolution plus added features and controls. I used the panorama stitch assist mode a few times for some neat landscape photos. Since the SX150IS seemed to be an upgrade in all ways and was cheaper as well (it had already been replaced by the SX160IS), I didn't even do a lot of research and just bought it. However, after a few months of using the SX150IS, I have learned that Canon seems to be cutting some corners. The 14.1 megapixel resolution is really closer to 10 MP effective, according to some review websites (and looking at full resolution pictures, I would agree). The panorama stitch assist is gone. And it seems to me that colors aren't represented as well and exposure selection isn't on target. You can try tweaking the exposure when outdoors by half-pressing the shutter at a brighter piece of sky to make the picture a little darker, but I was having to do this quite a bit (or change it through the menus which is more precise, but takes a little longer). In low light there is a good bit of noise, which maybe is typical for a camera at this price point, though some do better than others. I don't like the way they do the macro either. Previously it was a setting and once it was in macro, it stayed in macro. Now it sort of automatically pops in as needed. It doesn't seem as good and I had a harder time taking macro shots with this camera vs. the old one. Also the camera is fairly slow between pictures. In the end, I felt like it was more trouble than it was worth and I wanted something that was better than my old camera rather than worse. Even though I had only had the SX150IS for a few months, I ended up going for a significantly more expensive mirrorless camera with a bigger sensor, the Samsung NX1000 Black ~ 20.3MP Digital Camera with 20-50mm Lens, which doesn't have as good a zoom but otherwise should be very good. For the money, this is still a good camera, but don't expect too much.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Stevoson
Reviews.Content: Best Canon camera I have ever owned (last one I paid 250$ for). I use mine for E-Bay ads, it captures very fine details when zooming in. Only draw back with this camera was that it didn't have a battery recharger. A good deal for the money.

Reviews.Title: Not bad
Reviews.Author: SandyR
Reviews.Content: This camera was marked at $199.  I would not pay that price for it.  I got it for $79.  For that price it is a great buy.  It is not as durable as I had hoped but I like the features better than its higher priced sister.  Easy review and delete.  Auto flash or manual and takes great pics.  Doesn't have a setting for action specifically and have not tried that yet.

Reviews.Title: Only one issue
Reviews.Author: Jennifer
Reviews.Content: I can set the date and time and after a couple uses - I have to reset - does take great pictures tho

Reviews.Title: The PowerShot
Reviews.Author: grdngrower
Reviews.Content: I love this camera for it is not hard to operate and is not heavy in the hand.  I have had ones in the past, that were heavy and made me shake at times.  Plus the digital is very nice for you can see what you got and if not right can take another while you are there at the place you are wanting a good pic of.  Plus it is very simple to operate and easy to understand.  Thanks to Canom

Reviews.Title: Good camera at a good price
Reviews.Author: Paul Jordan
Reviews.Content: The camera was purchased 3 weeks ago for a trip. The pics were clear and the camera was easy to operate. The drawback would be the battery life…one should keep an extra set handy.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: KATHY NOWICKI
Reviews.Content: Camera is easy enough to carry around, but still takes high quality pictures.  Very happy with it and good price.

Reviews.Title: Arrived fine
Reviews.Author: Frances H Thomas
Reviews.Content: The box had been opened but all appeared to be there and it works fine.Like the AA batteries included.Dad will love it.

Reviews.Title: BArb
Reviews.Author: barb
Reviews.Content: we love this Canon camera. the first time i used it wasat my GRANDSONS Wedding. I'M STILL LEARNING ABOUT IT .AGAIN THANK YOU AMAZON.COM for being there for us.

Reviews.Title: This is a camera that has more capability than I know how to use.  Great pics!
Reviews.Author: Richard C. Anderson
Reviews.Content: Got this for my grandson's big trip through the major national parks -- Yellowstone, Mt Rushmore, the Badlands, Crazy Horse, Bryce, Zion, the North Rim of the Grand Canyon, etc.  He is very pleased!  Videos of Old Faithful, and hundreds of other pics.  Great zoom capability!  Got a 32 Gig memory card and the lithium ion double A batteries to go with it.  This thing appears to have no limits!

Reviews.Title: Good little camera
Reviews.Author: Kimberly willmott
Reviews.Content: I wanted something more day-to-day than my big Canon SLR. This fit the bill nicely. I really like the quick record button for video, I use it more than I expected to.

Reviews.Title: Canon Power
Reviews.Author: george potter
Reviews.Content: I really do like this camera, but would have liked it more if it didn't take AA batteries. I have found these batteries don't last too long.The overall camera it's self is great, I've always been rather fond of Canon Product. The quality of picture is great!Anyone that enjoys taking pictures and wants quality pictures, I would recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Good camera !
Reviews.Author: Bill "Bill"
Reviews.Content: Was surprised that it did not have a view finder separate from the view in the picture, which is sometimes hard to see in bright sunshine.  Still an acceptable purchase.

Reviews.Title: Love it ! My first Semi Professional Camera
Reviews.Author: Cesar Guijarro
Reviews.Content: It has a lot of features !!The resolution is ideal when you want to take your favorites pic's !It show's a new and high expression of your art !BUT....She is a compulsive batteries eater !!!

Reviews.Title: Not handy
Reviews.Author: jackleg
Reviews.Content: This is a heavy and awkward camera. great review but the batteries only last for a few shots .  Does not transport well.

Reviews.Title: just buy it
Reviews.Author: michael ruff
Reviews.Content: i had been viewing this camera since it first came out. for a point and shoot this camera by far out performs my expectations. having the digi-4 prossesor is a real plus for this price of a camera. had good pictures in low light setting without the flash.close-ups were very crisp and detailed. if you are looking for a point and shoot camera at a great price, no need to look any further, just buy it.

Reviews.Title: Good Basic Camera
Reviews.Author: Lee F. Johnston
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my 13 year old grandson.  Simple to use and very high quality pictures.  The zoom works great.  So far, no problems and very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing
Reviews.Author: C. Morin
Reviews.Content: I did receive this camera as a gift, otherwise, I probably would have returned it right away. There are pros to using this camera - it is definitely easy to use and there are many settings to make it easy to point and shoot. However, and this is a big one, the battery life is HORRIBLE. I put brand-new batteries in the camera and before I even actually use the camera, it has sucked some of the juice out of them. I find that if I keep the batteries out of the camera until I need to take pictures, it helps, but really, who wants to have to do that? This is unbelievably inconvenient. My last camera certainly didn't have as much of a zoom and didn't take such nice pictures but it had a reusable battery pack and charger. And it lasted for the whole day when I took my camera with me to shoot pictures. I wasn't constantly fumbling to replace spent batteries while missing important photo ops. I have seen other reviews that say use the rechargable batteries, and I do but I don't find that their battery life is much better in this camera as it is constantly pulling the juice from the batteries. It is getting very expensive to keep up with the amount of batteries needed to run my camera.  Video? Not terrific either. Oh, the picture and sound is fairly decent for capturing what I am aiming to get on video, but the batteries sometimes run out in the middle of shooting. I have to stop videotaping, put more batteries in, and resume - of course, missing special moments. And I am NOT talking long video recordings either! Plus, the darn camera heats up incredibly in the battery compartment when I am shooting five minutes or more of continuous video.  The other issue that I have with this camera is I lose virtually all spontaneous pictures of my kids that I try to take because the darn flash takes a ridiculous amount of time to charge at first use and in between every use. About 6 or 7 seconds to recharge means that I have missed the picture that I was hoping to capture. It als means that I can't keep shooting as things are happening, I have to sit and wait while I see the message battery charging, then I can shoot another picture. Horrible performance in this department. It's just really slow all around.  I am overall very disappointed with this camera and definitely do not recommend that anyone spend their money on a camera like this when there are so many others out there with better all around performance.

Reviews.Title: Had to return it.
Reviews.Author: Kingy47
Reviews.Content: It is super bulky and had problems using the flash. It also didn't always take pictures when I pressed the shutter button sometimes. On the plus it did take great video.

Reviews.Title: Canon rules
Reviews.Author: Mark Ward "Mantra"
Reviews.Content: I have only bought canon camera's since 2006 and the reason is this; Great quality at a good price.  Once gain Canon delivers as this camera has not let me down since its arrival.  Amazing photos, super sharp image, powerful zoom and an array of features to cover any photo shot.  It has an easy to use auto feature for the not so techy person that produces nice images and manual features for the person that wants to experiment a little more with their shots.  Absolutely fantastic buy for the price. The only surprise was the decision to return top AA batteries on these models but I do understand why as we have probably all experienced the cell battery dying and not being able to recharge, especially if you are away from the house or on vacation in another country.  The battery life is descent as long as you always turn off the camera after taking a photo.

Reviews.Title: Canon Complacent With Useless Camera
Reviews.Author: Colby E. Sanborn
Reviews.Content: Canon service was about as rude as possible when this camera was received Dead Out Of The Box.  They said it must have been dropped. Odd, the package in and out was perfect.Great delivery speed in time for my vacation next week, but now screwed. Thanks Canon for nothing. Amazon Customer Service was exceptional and I hope to have this camera sent back after my vacation.

Reviews.Title: Batteries required
Reviews.Author: Briddy
Reviews.Content: Does not have battery pack, burns through batteries a lot, is not good, does not do well with rechargeable too.

Reviews.Title: Very nice
Reviews.Author: PincPanther
Reviews.Content: I love the size of the screen, as it is very big and is very clear. The size is a big bigger than my old camera holder, so I am going to have to make a new one. Haven't taken too many photos on it, but am excited to see what comes of it. I think it offers a lot of control of the photo taker to make the photo how they want. There is a lot to choose from and provides all sorts of creative touches. I don't like how picky it seems to be with batteries. You can't use dollar store brand, thats for sure. And I feel like I am going to have to keep a huge stock on hand, or take trips to the store often to replace them if I don't take them out in between shoots. Other than that, I like it very much.

Reviews.Title: Very nice camera look and feel strong for a point and shoot camera
Reviews.Author: J. Tran
Reviews.Content: The built is strong and look and feel like a high quality. Not bad for point and shoot camera. My wife love this camera, she takes it every where she goes. The pictures that came out look nice, clear and shaft. The only bad thing about this camera is batteries drain out so quick. It's used 2AA. I took less than 50 pictures and I had to replaced new batteries. Most of my previous point and shoot camera had 4AA or 3.5v rechargeable battery. I took this camera to a foreign country and really hate to find a store to get battery, it really inconvenience. For the price, it is a great value $$$. Small and compact easy to put in a pocket or purse.

Reviews.Title: Battery issues
Reviews.Author: Kelly C. Milton
Reviews.Content: the battery won't stay charged regardless of what batteries we use!!  Any hints on what to do about that???  otherwise, wonderful camera!!

Reviews.Title: nice camera
Reviews.Author: Purplebeatlebug
Reviews.Content: This camera takes fantastic pictures but eats batteries like crazy!  It is easy to use and bigger than the smaller cameras.  Be sure and take millions of extra batteries, this camera uses more batteries than your ordinary camera.

Reviews.Title: A great tractor!
Reviews.Author: boy965
Reviews.Content: It takes okay pictures but the battery dies very fast chiefly when you take videos.I am going to try 1.67V rechargeable batteries. I hope they work. The lens is great and the problem with the flash is that it is not powerful enough. So, same as several other canon cameras, expect dark pictures indoor.

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: Karen S. Berger
Reviews.Content: Photo does not take right away, I have tried messing with the shutter speed but cant get it faster. I like the quality of the photos they all look great.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Melinda Jeffrey
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to use for family gatherings as well as concerts. It takes great pictures at concerts.  The price is very reasonable with all of the features and 12x zoom.

Reviews.Title: Cool Little camera
Reviews.Author: Bonita Roberts "roberts505"
Reviews.Content: I have the caon 7d and was looking for something that I could just shove in my pocket or purse. It's a little big for my pocket, but great for the purse. The in camera setting are pretty cool and the size is just about right. The only problem that I have had with the camera is that the flash takes up to 60 seconds to charge before firing. It's a great camera when I don't want to carry all of  my gear.

Reviews.Title: Too good Camera for Dummies
Reviews.Author: ninad
Reviews.Content: For users like parents or someone not too much into photography but looking for good picture quality, this is the camera. I own S95 also which is multi-functional compared to this, but this is a good accessory to have in your kitty.

Reviews.Title: excellent value
Reviews.Author: Uchae Im
Reviews.Content: this is a camera worth more than the price I paid. I will recommend it to anyone who need a excellent dica

Reviews.Title: Good Deal
Reviews.Author: Kevin Faroughi "kfaroughi"
Reviews.Content: I am happy that I purchased it for my parents. They love it because it’s easy to use and capture a very clear picture. Recommend it.

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: M. Fleurkens
Reviews.Content: It does exactly what I expected it to do. The flash takes some time to charge, but I knew that from earlier models

Reviews.Title: Great price and camera
Reviews.Author: Kathleen Fox-laskowiecki "fix"
Reviews.Content: A friend had this camera and I love it.  The camera has a great zoom feature and for the price is amazing.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: Ying Meng
Reviews.Content: I'm so glad that I bought a Canon PowerShot  SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera.I love it because it takes pictures very clear and beautiful.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera but eats batteries.
Reviews.Author: starstruck
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera despite the reviews saying it eats a lot of batteries. They were understated!  My wife likes it or I probably would have returned it. It will only get about 20 shots out of alkaline batteries! It does a lot better on the expensive lithium batteries but is still costly to operate if you are used to taking a lot of photos and deleting them later. From what I have read the rechargeable type will not last through very many images either before you must recharge or replace. It's because this camera reads a partially discharged battery as dead and stops operating when in reality the battery still has lots of life left in it which is the way alkalines are meant to work.  It does take good photos though and is very light weight.

Reviews.Title: It's good for the price.
Reviews.Author: Speed Daemon
Reviews.Content: I'm getting into photography as a hobby and this camera has full manual control so that you can set the aperture (f/3.4 - f/8.0), shutter speed (15" - 1/2500") and ISO (80 - 1600) separately for total exposure control.Photograph quality is reasonable, not great. Outdoor shots are the easiest because of the good lighting. Low light conditions are a bit challenging, but I was able to manipulate manipulate the settings to get pretty decent indoor shots without using the flash.As regards the battery life I had on hand some heavily used NiMh rechargeable batteries and some new eneloops. Here's a comparison of the total amount of shots (without flash) I was able to take before the camera shut down because of the low battery warning:Radio Shack HR6 (6 years old): 20 shotsPanasonic 1950 (9 years old): 48 shotsSanyo Eneloops (new): 96 shotsBased on those results I estimate about 3 pairs of good quality NiMh batteries should be more than sufficient to take care of my shooting stints at any one time.Honestly the camera has everything that I need at this stage and for the 100 bucks I paid, I'm more than happy.

Reviews.Title: very good
Reviews.Author: Vinh
Reviews.Content: This camera is very good  i liked , i gave my friend for  birthday , I think .they will be enjoy with it

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "AZ Guy RN"
Reviews.Content: Great pictures & easy to use. Out of the box able to use right away. Really liked being able to use AA batteries. Can get a dozen at the Dollar store for $3. Very happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: nice camera happy with purchace!
Reviews.Author: viletstar2
Reviews.Content: pro:perfect sizefeels like your actually holding something yet you can take it with you.love the color cant miss it!takes AA batteries!love canon!con:flash could charge faster

Reviews.Title: Not that pleased.
Reviews.Author: R. Roslund
Reviews.Content: Misses lots of great shots because it takes to long to react once you have pushed the button. A disappointment.

Reviews.Title: Good for beginner
Reviews.Author: G.Janelle
Reviews.Content: It a great camera, good for me as I have few skills on taking pics. but uses many batteries, buy alot of them.

Reviews.Title: Good product
Reviews.Author: TL
Reviews.Content: Best camerea for the price.  Great quality when playing back videos on big flat screen television. I would recommend it to friends

Reviews.Title: Right Quality for Price
Reviews.Author: Steve Utter
Reviews.Content: Picture quality is good.  Buttons are not intuitive but you can figure them out quickly with the book. Time will tell if it holds up.

Reviews.Title: Takes Amazing VIVID PIX's ! !
Reviews.Author: BCRetired
Reviews.Content: This is the third one of these I have had.  They all take great pictures.  My problem is I am quite HARD on cameras...and wish they were built a little more rugged.  Love the HD videos and the sound recording is pretty good for a camera in this price range.

Reviews.Title: best damn camera... period!
Reviews.Author: Michael F. Berry "micber"
Reviews.Content: I have had years of photography classes yet this shoots better.  it can be manual if you want or auto if you want.  auto normally gets what you need easily and it doesnt take a bad picture.  its amazing!

Reviews.Title: Generally very satisfied.
Reviews.Author: Rolf Haag
Reviews.Content: My wife is the family photographer. She's very happy with the unit, but needs more time to fully master its use.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Nish
Reviews.Content: This camera is a great compact digital camera.  It performs well and has a lot of features as described.  I think it is a very good value for what you get.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot
Reviews.Author: Kevin Gordon
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice camera, it takes great pictures. I am still getting a bit use to it so I rated it 4 stars instead of 5.

Reviews.Title: Very good Canon at excellent price
Reviews.Author: Stefan Sommerfield
Reviews.Content: I recently bought three of these Canon SX 150's, two to give to kids who will be traveling with us this summer, and one to use myself. The SX 150 appealed to me due to its 14.1 mega pixels, good zoom, and great price available from a variety of retailers. My wife uses the SX 160 which is more compact, which is why I am only giving the 150 4 stars, but its ease of use, excellent picture quality, and 40x digital zoom make-up for the size.I am not big on using the manual settings but they seem to be of value for more serious photographers; am pretty content with the automatic point and shoot choices for most travel situations. Low light without flash is good, particularly helpful in chuches or museums where "no flash" is allowed.Have used point and shots with both AA single use and lithium rechargable batteries. I personally prefer the Energizer Lithium (silver and blue) which yield the highest number of shots, or longest video time. I have averaged 200-250 shots on better cameras (Panasonic Lumix) and reaching as many as 350 on older, less featured ones (simpler Kodaks).Rechargables AA's are ok, but you will rearely get a full day of shooting from one pair, needing spares and a good multi recharger for overnight.Canon has always produced excellent cameras from really small point and shoots (the original Elf's) to full DSLR's. The SX 150 offers excellent shooting at a great price.

Reviews.Title: awesome for aspiring ameteur
Reviews.Author: star
Reviews.Content: Got this as a step up from my old point and shoot. Works well! Easy! Great quality pictures! Has lots features great for snapping shots while chasing/caring for a newly mobile baby! Almost no blur!

Reviews.Title: Very happy with this camera!!!
Reviews.Author: Monique
Reviews.Content: I simply love this camera. This is my first Canon, I have a Nikon D5000 that I only use occasionally when looking for great pictures outdoor or at weddings and special events, and now I was looking for a point and shoot, small to take with me everywhere. And I can tell you, Canon really knows its business. I use this camera mainly to take pictures of jewelry that I sell online and it works great!!! The camera is very smart, captures color very nicely, its very easy to work with and has great functions. The lenses are awesome, and the pictures comes out very clear and beautiful. The only reason why I give this camera 4 stars is it's size. It is a bit bulky for my taste. But you can't beat the less than $150 price! Its worth way more than that.I did purchase a Battery charger for it here on Amazon because the battery's life is really short! But with the charger I have no problems at all. If you are vacationing and this is your camera, make sure you buy the charger and plug in every night, cause you will run out of battery pretty fast.In resume: great pictures, easy to work with, awesome price and a true CANON! You can't go wrong with it!Canon is definitely the way to go.

Reviews.Title: I read a lot of reviews before choosing this camera
Reviews.Author: A. Larson
Reviews.Content: I had a powershot SX110 and looked at a lot of cameras at a lot of prices and settled on this one.  It's great and the price I paid was $108 or so.  I sense that this camera uses batteries at a faster rate than the SX110 but has better picture quality and more versatility.

Reviews.Title: You're getting an awful lot of camera for incredible price
Reviews.Author: Dayro Longas
Reviews.Content: -Inexpensive-Sharp pictures-Great coloursYou're getting an awful lot of camera for incredible price, not only in terms of physical size, but features too.Negative Point: When the batteries are discharged, capturing photos can become sluggish

Reviews.Title: Cherry red!
Reviews.Author: Kat Tale
Reviews.Content: Color would look good on a car!  I like this camera and have used it quite a bit with the automatic setting.  Still need to explore more of its features.  Another entry on my list of owner's manuals to read....

Reviews.Title: Great Except For Battery Life
Reviews.Author: John Nickerson
Reviews.Content: I had a previous version of this camera. When that one was lost I purchased this model to replace it. The big upgrade on this model is that the movie function is now 720P HD. The other nice change is in the way you can switch to video mode. The previous model required you to rotate the selector on top of the camera until you reached the video camera symbol and then press the shutter button to start and stop the video function. This model has a button on the back of the camera in a handy place for your thumb which instantly starts the video function regardless of what mode the camera is in. When you stop the video you are immediately back in still mode ready to take a picture. This a really a big improvement. Now for the down side. This camera absolutely eats batteries! I took it to a Christmas party and took 10 stills and about 30 minutes of video all together and went through four pairs of AA alkaline batteries. If you buy this camera, do yourself a favor and get some re-chargable batteries!

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: Jacqueline Rogean
Reviews.Content: I have used this camera from day 1 and it takes the most wonderful pictures.  Makes me look like a pro.  I love this camera.  Thank you.

Reviews.Title: Great Point and Shoot Camera
Reviews.Author: AvA_Martini
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera.  I use rechargeable NiMH Energizer batteries and have had no problem with the camera not lasting more than a couple of shots.  It usually lasts me the whole day if I'm not often using the flash.  I love the features, especially the Toy Camera and the Miniature effects.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price and size
Reviews.Author: Kate C.
Reviews.Content: This is a great point and shoot camera. For the size and price it is great at what it does.One thing to consider is that the flash takes some time to load after each picture but other than that, perfect.

Reviews.Title: Very nice point and shoot.
Reviews.Author: Robert Hylant
Reviews.Content: Takes great pictures, and is easy to learn. For most phots almost as good as a heavy SLR and alot more convient to carry.

Reviews.Title: capture the moment
Reviews.Author: Cynthia
Reviews.Content: I got this as a Christmas gift for my daughter to capture all of my first grandson's milestones.  Does the job!

Reviews.Title: very awesome camera
Reviews.Author: daisy2012
Reviews.Content: this camera is very responsive and takes good pictures of moving things too without blurring.  The zoom is also quite good and does not look blurry either and it has an easy setting for beginners wich is nice too.  I have been obessing over this camera for nearly a year and read lots of reveiws, I'm so glad that I waited to get this camera it was worth it

Reviews.Title: Cannon Power Shot Camera.
Reviews.Author: Donna Green "Bird Lady"
Reviews.Content: Yes! This is one neat camera. I love the size of the viewing screen and the ease of using the camera.  It nice size for every day use and convient to carry.  Great Price.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Katie Gaskins
Reviews.Content: Great camera!  Good size and not too heavy for a larger size purse.  I only gave this 4 stars because it goes through batteries very rapidly.  I carry 4 spare batteries with me whevener I plan on using this camera.

Reviews.Title: This camera eats batteries for lunch
Reviews.Author: Neil
Reviews.Content: It actually takes great pictures weather it be in full sun or low light conditions and I love the zoom feature. With the flash on it takes about 6-8 seconds between shots which I find very slow and it really drains the batteries after roughly 30 pics taken, even with lithium batteries.This was a replacement of my Canon Powershot A610 that finally died after 7 yrs which held 4 AA batteries, this camera only holds 2 AA's. If you plan to get this camera pack lots of AA batteries. I plan to keep the camera although I'm not happy with its performance when taking multiple shots with the flash on and supplement it with a better performing model.

Reviews.Title: a great camera...
Reviews.Author: Romy C.
Reviews.Content: A little big to fit in my party bag :) , great great zoom and good quality images. With rechargeable batteries, no problem.

Reviews.Title: Omg, this camera is incredible!!! Canon is amazing as it has always been!!!
Reviews.Author: J. Morris "Zebu"
Reviews.Content: So this thing takes better pictures than I could have ever imagined! I went outside and took close up pictures of a buttercup flower and that night I went and took a close up of the moon. Both turned out clear and perfect! WOW!!! love lovelovethis camera, my dad just got one too after seeing mine and he used to be a photographer. :)

Reviews.Title: Dont waste your money
Reviews.Author: Holly Elliott "holly"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to upgrade from my old one. This camera is user friendly but is slow!!!!!!!!!!! It does not take pictures on command. It actually always come up with a "charging flash" when needing to use the flash and this caused me to miss a lot of great pictures of my kids. The camera then broke after 6 months of light use and I don't even know why. I am buying Nikon not wasting anymore money with canon products. Disapointed

Reviews.Title: Battery life is super short
Reviews.Author: Sarah E Winkler
Reviews.Content: The batteries go really quickly, is larger than other cameras I've had, and can seem a bit slow at times when trying to capture kids, but overall it takes quality photos for my purposes, and I love that I can use it with the software from my old camera

Reviews.Title: just what I needed
Reviews.Author: John Cooper
Reviews.Content: Great camera with nice clear image and a good zoom.  It was exactly what my wife was looking for without me having to spend top dollar.

Reviews.Title: Ok Camera to have.. But I would prefer lithium battery cameras in future..
Reviews.Author: AJ
Reviews.Content: Onlt problem is it's not coming with chargeable lithium batteries.It drains the batterries very fast. otherwise quality of pictures it takes is very good.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: V. Koestner "HAPPY SHOPPER"
Reviews.Content: Easy to operate and understand.  Ordered it for my mom and she loves it.  She can take pictures so easy and it zooms so well so she can get great pictures. Pictures are so clear and so easy to take.

Reviews.Title: Nice unit for the $$
Reviews.Author: Sky Sox Wiz
Reviews.Content: It has the heft and snug feel of a big camera.  I dropped and broke my miniscule Canon 300HS and decided this was a good substitute.  I enjoy the special features options but (subjectively) think my 300HS took better low-light photos.  I have a Canon 110HS on order and hope it's shutter lag will be better than the SX150.

Reviews.Title: So happy with this camera
Reviews.Author: BriRG
Reviews.Content: Now, I had no idea about camera technology. I had to do my research, but seeing the reviews and the price I felt like I had to give this a shot.I'm still learning all the manual settings, I really have no idea what I'm doing. But that is what makes this a great camera.My friend has a $1000 camera and I swear it takes pictures comparable to that. It is very easy to use and as long as your not moving while taking the picture (I had to learn this) you will get good pictures.I took this camera on my first trip to New York and I am so happy I decided to go with this one.Like I've mentioned a couple times, I'm still learning how to use it, but the zoom was great. I took pictures of the Statue of Liberty from the Staten Island Ferry and they were so clear that you could see a bird perched on her crown.There are many complaints in other reviews about battery life, which I have to agree. The batteries DO NOT last long. Throughout my trip, which was only 4 days and I took 249 pictures, I had to change out batteries 4 times. I asked my camera experienced friend about it and she explained, that is what you get with cameras that take real batteries and not rechargeable. I was sure to bring plenty of new batteries on the trip, so it wasn't a big deal. I just wouldn't recommend this if you plan on using it very frequently.It is very nice to have a camera that easily takes quality pictures to share with friends and family, and I didn't have to save up for it.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: CJG
Reviews.Content: Bought as Christmas gift last year(2011) for our son.  He uses it all the time. Taking pictures of everything he likes from cars to buildings, farm equipment, anything everything.  Takes good pictures and would recommend for any novice. Wish it was rechargable.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Cj
Reviews.Content: The camera is easy to use.  It has enough weight to it that makes it easier to hold and handle.

Reviews.Title: Canon powershot sx150
Reviews.Author: Orlandodr
Reviews.Content: It is an excellent camara and a great price. nice vid rec, nice zoom quality, etc, I will recommend it.

Reviews.Title: easy to use
Reviews.Author: andre
Reviews.Content: i bought the camera for my daughter who is a sophomore in high school for her photography class. She has learned all the functions of the camera and has an A+ in the class she loves the camera great buy.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SX150 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera with 12x Wide-Angle Optical
Reviews.Author: Carnevale
Reviews.Content: Realy good for a trip with kids. Point and shot.It is necessary to have 2 extras batteries for one day with intensive usage.

Reviews.Title: camera review
Reviews.Author: C.PHX
Reviews.Content: I was able to use the camera on a recent vacation. I found it extremely easy to use. I still have more to learn about all of its capabilities, but so far I have not been lost in tech-speak.  I was slightly surprised how fast it burned thru batteries, so I'm with-holding judgement in that area for now just incase it was simply a poor batch of batteries that I got ahold of. I was very impressed with the audio recording capabilities, it had a nice range. The price is fair. I have not found anything that it advertises to be to be anything less then as stated.

Reviews.Title: Canon SX150
Reviews.Author: ftrinh1
Reviews.Content: older model but can't beat the price. Excellent features for point and shoot camera and very good photo quality, 2AA batteries making it great for travelling

Reviews.Title: Overall a good buy..
Reviews.Author: 1st mate
Reviews.Content: For a point & shoot camera it works very well.It takes good video & the software is easy to use.Picture quality is very good even when cropped.Easy operation & multifunction setting a plus.It is a bit power hungry if you use the flash a lot.1St Mate Jim.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE this Camera
Reviews.Author: Gabrielle Gewirtz
Reviews.Content: I needed a new camera that i could take backpacking with me BUT was a step up from my last Canon digital camera.WOW! it is light enough to take with a large weekend/weeklong pack AND takes incredible pictures.The zoom feature is spot on and the ease of switching settings - bott preset and customizable ones - is just great.If you have had a Canon before - all the language is the same - so the learning curve is minimal.Great Camera!

Reviews.Title: A good quality camera for a fair price
Reviews.Author: vagabohn
Reviews.Content: First, I am a Canon product lover, having owned numerous electronics of their brand.  This camera was purchased to replace another and I investigated several well known brands before purchasing.  I was totally impressed with the features and even made a trip to a local discount store to look at it first hand.  It is simple to operate and takes clear and sharp photo's in almost any setting.  It took a while to remember to manually pop up the flash attachment but that is the only down side I can think of.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SX150
Reviews.Author: Bliff
Reviews.Content: I bought this Camera to take on my trip to Ireland. I would recommend this camera to anyone. However, be aware it eats batteries! Turning it on and off between viewing points and using the zoom makes it eat the batteries. Often changing the twice a day. Picture quality is great!

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot bought at Amazon
Reviews.Author: Craig Snellings "Bluzman"
Reviews.Content: I am not a real techy person. This camera fits the bill. It is not hard to operate or to figure out. Its takes a real nice picture and is exactly what I needed in a camera.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: mrmacgregor
Reviews.Content: I love this camera; it's light to carry and so easy to use.  Extremely satisfied with indoor quality for the price.  Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Good camera, slow flash
Reviews.Author: Mark Twain
Reviews.Content: This camera can be a good starting point for someone who wants to explore photography.Pros:1) Lots of manual features2) Very decent optics (for the price paid of course)3) AA batteries, so that you never run out of powerCons:1) It is not a camera to use in low light conditions. It's just not, as the flash recharges within 10 seconds!2) 100 shots per set of batteries. Spare batteries should be always handy.

Reviews.Title: Canon  Powershot SX150
Reviews.Author: Judy T
Reviews.Content: This is my second Canon camera and I absolutely love it.  I broke the first one and could not find one like it in our stores around here and bought a digital Canon Powershot A3300IS and it just did not work as well as my first one, so I went looking and found the one I have now and I love the way it works, and I love that it uses batteries instead of having to be charged.  IT just does not hold a charge for very long and sometimes there isn't a plug to recharge it.( I am talking about the Powershot  A3300). With the PowershotSX150,  It is  just easier to carry extra batteries and they usually last a little longer than the recharge battery.  I love my camera. Thanks.  Judy T

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT
Reviews.Author: Holly
Reviews.Content: i love this camera!! takes beautiful pics. i had a Kodiak camera before this one it took ok pics but this one is way better! VERY PLEASED!!! i would highly recommend this camera to my friends! price is good.

Reviews.Title: Good easy to use camera
Reviews.Author: Bob B
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera.  It's great for an adult who wants a point and shoot that is easy to carry, but it's also easy enough for a kid to use. We bought it for our 12 year old daughter who has been really into photography for a few years. She was frustrated with grainy images from a cheaper camera.  The red color keeps it from getting lost so easy. It seems very rugged.  My Dad and a brother also have the exact same camera.  They're really happy with it as well.  With good light, the pics are excellent.

Reviews.Title: Batteries, You Need Batteries
Reviews.Author: C. Dowden
Reviews.Content: Needed a camera in a hurry and bought mine on the road in Best Buy today. Paid a bit more than this (what ever the current price shown is), but walked out of the store with it. Used it minutes later.My verified purchaser copy of this review is at the Canon SX130. Liked the 150 so well that I ordered the slightly less featured 130 a couple of days after buying the 150.Controls are "intuitive" if you have had a few digital cameras. Pics look great for the documentation and illustration that I do. All the features and gee-wiz may be fantastic for all I know. Do you need a self-timer that starts when you enter the picture and blink your eyes? I don't think I do, but you might.Easy access to manual control is great when images must match in exposure for after-the-fact editing. No raw output tho. Turn off the image review or you spend your time waiting in between pics.Larger size and greater weight make it easier to hand hold especially in lower light. And image stabilization really works well. This camera could better use strap lugs, rings, and a shoulder strap instead of a wrist strap. Ring type selector around the function set button beats hell out of a slew of tiny buttons and lots of tabbed sub menus. - A little too easy to bump things tho while intending to change one setting and accidentally changing another.Experiments moving from sensitivity of 80 or 100 have been mixed. I'm not impressed. With most digitals and oh so long ago with film I have found that higher sensitivity is a trade-off with noise.This camera uses batteries. Take a bunch of the highest capacity NiMH AA that you can get your hands on. Make sure they are in good shape and fully charged! I'm getting 100 to 150 shots out of each pair of new 2300s before getting a low battery warning. Or about two thirds the number of shots from what I got out of my previous camera. - Have to figure that features like image stabilization are not a loss-free operation.A Targus TGC SC610 Case will hold this camera and four more AA batteries easily. Belt loop looks a little iffy, but a carabiner as a back-up gives me peace of mind.I think this camera will work out fine for what I need: clear shots with good detail.

Reviews.Title: LOVE THIS CAMERA!!!
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Gerdes "Eitzy"
Reviews.Content: This camera is great!  A co-worker and I each bought this camera and we love it.  She just got back from Mexico and all of the pictures were beautiful!  The colors and the clarity of each image is amazing.  I also love the fish eye effects-the pictures you can come up with are so entertaining.  My favorite things also include the automatic function that will take a self portrait when it sees a smile, and the fact that it takes AA batteries.  Nothing is better when traveling than being able to use regualar batteries that are readily available almost everywhere.  There's nothing worse than having to recharge a battery when you're out and about and won't be near a plug-in until evening.  I always use the Energizer max battieries.  I was able to go to Europe and use only 2 sets of those while taking over 1400 pictures.  Just keep an extra set or 2 with you and you're always ready to roll.  Both me and my co-worker will be heading to Vegas in 2 weeks and I'm so excited to be able to see what kind of pictures we can get there!

Reviews.Title: Decent camera
Reviews.Author: mrbazooka
Reviews.Content: This is a very decent camera for outdoor shooting. But indoor it falls a little shot. Have not been able to get very good pictures indoors. The flash always seems inadequate even if you are close. The video is ok. I also find the lens movement a bit noisy. As usual the shipping was great from Amazon.

Reviews.Title: What a nice friendly camera
Reviews.Author: Kyra Collins
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because we do dog rescue and I needed a camera that had more speed than my previous digital camera but was simple enough for an idiot to use. I have not ventured into any of the bells & whistles yet, but the camera has taken some superb photos even on the auto-setting, and it has certainly helped place some dogs into new homes.

Reviews.Title: excellent uncomplicated camera
Reviews.Author: landlocked
Reviews.Content: This turned out to be a perfect camera for us.  It is small enough, yet not tiny. Goes anywhere.  It is SIMPLE, just point and shoot.  The images have been terrific.  I am just now learning about the numerous options to achieve special effects, when it is desired.  It does go through batteries...so we have bought charger and rechargeable ones dedicated to camera, no big deal.  We got a great price through Amazon, quick delivery when camera was not in stock anywhere locally.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: L. Morey
Reviews.Content: Takes great shots, even without flash in subdued lighting.  Has unique, fun features (blink).  Only disappointment was that it didn't have a panorama shot function.  Could maybe achieve it with the "continuous shot" feature and merging pictures, but not easy to hand to someone else to take these shots so as to get in photo yourself plus the effort of joining the photos.  Takes great zoom pictures.

Reviews.Title: Canon SX150 IS
Reviews.Author: Evlampia Papoutsi "disturbia"
Reviews.Content: It is an impressive camera, the resolution is great and the zoom great. The only problem is battery drainage..you need to have an extra pair always with you.

Reviews.Title: Camera Review
Reviews.Content: This camera was as expected.  It has all the features as advertised and they all worked well.  The included documentation explained all functions of the camera.  It would have been nice to have the option to order a memory card with it.

Reviews.Title: Great features at low cost and simple to use
Reviews.Author: K. Akella
Reviews.Content: Amazed to see all the features; complex, yet simple user interface. Affordable price - cannot expect anything better. Impressed by the calrify of pictures and portability to PC. Only drawback is the battery - does not last long enough for a day's trip.

Reviews.Title: Good for casual users
Reviews.Author: Barrry Catlett
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my 17 year old daughter for Christmas.  She loves everything about it except battery life - it goes through AA's like crazy. I bought a similar Canon model for my older daughter a year ago and she is also happy.  As a fairly advanced photographer, I consider this a good choice for people wanting a bit more than simple point & shoot functionality, but who don't need professional caliber gear. Canon is always a good choice (Nikon too, which I use).

Reviews.Title: Canon always delivers quality (though I got a lemon, today)
Reviews.Author: Laif
Reviews.Content: I can't leave a very long review, because the item I received (while cosmetically perfect and new in the box) was defective. It had an electrical fault, which meant that it churned through my first and second sets of new alkaline AA batteries in about fifteen minutes (and ten photos) each - and the third set registered empty the moment I put them in.Be mindful as you read this, that I'm loyal to the Canon brand, and am comparing this machine to what I've used of their cameras in past years. If you're a convert from a brand like Panasonic, you might be rightfully wowed by what Canon delivers in the SX150IS. However, personally, I'm disappointed.Canon has excellent photo quality, and this camera appears to be no exception to that rule. Certainly, this model has more resolution, and therefore less dreaminess in the color quality than my 6 megapixel S3IS model I was so fond of and which was stolen from me last spring in Hawaii. The SX150IS case visually looks very nice: it's matte, rather than glossy - which means that the suave look will last longer. Sadly, however, the camera somehow isn't made in a way that molds to your hand, unlike the S3 series. The SX150 does have a nice weight to it, though - and thus feels very professional (and this probably helps to stabilize panning while taking films).I'm kind of disappointed that camera technology hasn't iterated as quickly in five years as you would expect from computer desktop technology or cell phone tech. Certainly, there are some important improvements to button layout, including dedicated picture review button, and on/off button, and a little bit easier layout of the functions around the wheel. That will no doubt make a huge difference for good in a person's day-to-day use of the camera.Even using a tripod, the quality of the photos at the full extent of the optical zoom is really tawdry; it's almost as if you passed the photo through an "oil-paint" photoshop filter. There's a reason why people want an optical zoom rather than a digital zoom, and there doesn't seem to be much improvement with this camera.The one really thoughtful bit of engineering that I immediately was impressed with, is that the screen is actually set back half a centimeter - behind a piece of plexiglass which is, itself, flush with the housing. This means that while the plastic (why don't manufacturers ever want to use glass?!) might get scratched up from keys in the pocket, it is protected from any more serious damage.

Reviews.Title: Very Clear Image
Reviews.Author: Heather Larrabee
Reviews.Content: I got this camera recently in replace of my old Kodak C300. This is not too big, slightly larger then a Kodak. The Image it GREAT! For a cheap camera it is worth every cent. The only flaw is that it does not have an eye hole, but the large screen makes up for it. I would recommend it for anyone. A first timer, someone who needs a camera, or a photographer. I hope this helps someone out with their decision, I just want too say, I LOVE THIS CAMERA!

Reviews.Title: SMALL CAMERA WITH INCREDIBLE FEATURE AND ACCURACY
Reviews.Author: Y.B
Reviews.Content: HII GOT THIS CAMERA 2 DAYS AGO.IT WAS GREAT RIGHT OUT OF BOX.WELL MADE.BIG SCREEN GREAT SHOTS.THE ONLY COMPLAIN IS ABOUT BATTERY CONSUMING.I THINK BY PURCHASING HIGH CAPACITY  RECHARGEABLE BATTERY WITH USB CHARGER,THERE WOULD BE NO MORE COMPLAINS.PRO.BIG SCREEN  14X OPTICAL ZOOM.  INTERESTING DESIGN IN CAMERA(SPECIALLY FLASH).  ABILITY TO TAKE ,SAVE ,EDIT PHOTO AND MOVIE IN VARIOUS QUALITY AND FRAMECONS: BATERY  WORKING WITH IT A LITTLE BIT CONFUSING  FINDING PROPER CASE FOR CARRY IT

Reviews.Title: battery bottomless pit!
Reviews.Author: S. K. Ramsdell
Reviews.Content: I bought this because I like using double-a batteries and not having to have a charger.  I used the batteries that came with the camera and took a total of 28 photos and the "low battery" light started flashing!  Just won't do the job for me so back it went.

Reviews.Title: Good but Bad...
Reviews.Author: Juliette
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera very excited.Pros:It takes great picturesfor a low priceit has hd videogreat zoomcons:horrible battery lifehugepictures with flash takes 10 seconds to captureblurryvideo doesn't match up with soundDON'T BUY THIS CAMERA.

Reviews.Title: Pretty darn good...
Reviews.Author: Tom Noble "Tom"
Reviews.Content: Haven't used it long enough to be able to review really well, but the camera seems to be good as far as lens and sensor are concerned - clean pix.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY.
Reviews.Author: Anthony Voci
Reviews.Content: These Powershot Cameras have a #1620 battery inside that CANNOT be replaced unless you work for NASA.  Once it dies the camera will not function.  Yes, it takes incredible photos and can be shot in manual mode like an old professional film camera but it is designed to die after about 2 years.  I took it apart and found the #1620 battery on the far left side of the camera to the left of the view screen.  This battery operates the red low light focus beam and the time delay shutter beam.  That beam does not operate off the two AA batteries on the right side.  It's a disgusting world we live in when such a fine piece of technology is designed to be thrown away.  I'll never buy a Canon product again.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT.
Reviews.Author: Carole Talley
Reviews.Content: DO NOT BUY THIS CAMERA... I purchased it for my daughter for her birthday, and it drains the batteries with one occassion use..

Reviews.Title: Worst Canon I Have Owned
Reviews.Author: K. Frick "The Dude"
Reviews.Content: This thing is really picky about batteries.  If you don't use high-performance camera batteries, the low-battery indicator will come on almost immediately.The HD video was the best thing about this camera, and it was great initially.  But not for long because...The worst thing about this camera is that dust gets into the camera and lands on two different lens surfaces that cannot be cleaned because they are encased in the zoom mechanism.  That is, there are two layers of glass in the lens, one external, and one internal, and dust will get into the camera sooner than later and stick to both sides of the internal glass lens and there is no way of cleaning it out.  The result is a bunch of blurry spots or glare spots on all your photos and videos that are taken with the camera pointed anywhere remotely close to a bright sky (or in the direction of bright artificial lights).I have only owned Canons for the past 15 years or so.  I have loved them for the picture quality, generally higher quality than other cameras even when the Canons have fewer megapixels than their competition.  The SX150 is a lemon.  I can't imagine it will be the last Canon that I own, but it is far and away the worst Canon I have owned.

Reviews.Title: the batteries die a lot
Reviews.Author: mathew
Reviews.Content: the batteries die a lot it doesnt go 15 min with out talking battiers picture quitly is good  and it doesnt take up to much space

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot
Reviews.Author: CLB2
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because I wanted something smaller than my Canon Rebel. I love it fits right in my hands. I am still figuring out some of the features but it's great. The delivery was excellent and timely.

Reviews.Title: great pictures
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This takes fantastic pictures, with an easy zoom.  It is a lot heavier and bulkier than previous cameras, however.  And you have to manually raise the flash.  I'm used to automatic flashes and not having to think about it.  But overall, I have been very satisfied.  And you can take fish eye pictures (which is hilarious when it's a picture of your dog)

Reviews.Title: no eye piece
Reviews.Author: Susan K. Phillips "Reading teacher 91"
Reviews.Content: My husband does not like the fact that there is no eye piece and the camera is bigger than the older version of the powershot.

Reviews.Title: Inexcusable
Reviews.Author: m.pendleton
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera since March 15th, 2013 and I am having the same problems that I have had with this model on 2 previous occasions. This is my third camera since my original purchase on July 24, 2012. Each camera has the same problem: a display of a flashing battery, then the camera will shut down and says" change the batteries", which fails to remedy the problem. I may have taken a total of 30 pics, tops, before this camera shut down. This one and the previous one were refurbished. I am furious with Canon and this PowerShot model- this model is completely unreliable for vacations. I would like Canon to refund my purchase price for this camera(they refused)so that I can make a more quality purchase from another manufacturer. This is incredible that I continue to have the same problems, regardless of the battery type. It is stored in it's case when not in use and none have ever been damaged. I have had the same problem with the A1300(sent in in March of 2013). I fully expect them to breakdown as well given the quality of the manufacturer. I simply cannot in good conscience write exactly how furious I am with this issue. Once the "change the battery" comes on- it's too late, the camera is done for. This was the first camera I have ever bought and it is a huge headache. I can't trust it on vacations any other important event. DO NOT PURCHASE THIS MODEL OE THE A1300. My sons cameras have both been sent in for the same issue and they received them at Christmas!

Reviews.Title: Great for Beginner
Reviews.Author: Elora
Reviews.Content: Wanted a new "pocket" camera and Canon has been good to me.  Not what I expected. Great camera for someone learning photography.

Reviews.Title: Eats up the battery!
Reviews.Author: bc
Reviews.Content: I took this camera on a 2 week African safari and replace the batteries 7 times!  It was horrible.  It takes great pictures, but who wants to keep replacing the batteries.  And no I did not take thousands of pics.  I took 205!

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SX150
Reviews.Author: J. Mock
Reviews.Content: Absolutely love this camera.  I'm just a novice but I love that I can finally take really nice photos with a compact camera. The stabilized zoom is fantastic for me because I can't hold a camera completely steady and I have not had one blurry photo with this so far.  It is a bit heavier than the average pocket camera but well worth it, especially at this price.  I did get only 80 pictures with the set of batteries included but I've found that to be the case with most electronics that have batteries included.  Haven't taken but 20 pictures with new batteries so will have to see how that goes. Definitely recommend this camera to anyone that wants great photos, near or far shots, with little effort.

Reviews.Title: Cannon SX150 IS
Reviews.Author: Ed
Reviews.Content: I ordered the item and it was delivered to me within 4 days.  Price was good shipping time was excellent.  I picked this camera because I want to be able to take pictures in multiple settings yet not need to worry about special battery packs.  I recommend that you get rechargeable batteries to along with the camera, and make sure that they are not the generic rechargeable batteries.  The camera does go through batteries fairly fast and the cheaper ones do not last as long or recharge as many times.

Reviews.Title: most camera for the money
Reviews.Author: Neil F. Katz "Other Guy"
Reviews.Content: this camera was selected for it's features and capacity and delivers in all regards and then some -- only clinker is that must use a certain kind of battery --- but the pictures are great -- the camera is the best bank for the buck

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SX150
Reviews.Author: C. Lounsbury
Reviews.Content: I was excited to get this camera and found it easy to use right out of the box.  The zoom is great and the photos are clear.  Double A batteries mean that replacements are always available.  However, right after my purchase, Amazon competed with itself by offering the ELPH 510HS at pretty much the same price on the Deal of the Day.  Since the ELPH was really the size I had initially wanted (The SX150 is kind of bulky and doesn't fit easily into a purse), I returned it and purchased the ELPH.  For a point and shoot person, the ELPH is perfect, especially with a great zoom, but for someone with a bit more skill and interest in the art of photography, the SX150 offers lots of user interaction options.

Reviews.Title: Great Pictures
Reviews.Author: Ryan
Reviews.Content: Love it, except battery life. have plenty on hand and make sure you use "Lithium" batteries. otherwise it is a really good camera.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: riptrack2
Reviews.Content: Camera was more than I expected.  It takes great photos both with and without the flash.  I like how easy it is to customize the shots as well as how easy it is to point and shot quick photos.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing picture sharpness
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Tried to find camera that was easy to use while delivering consistently reliable photo sharpness.  Will continue to look for the sharpness part. It is easy to use for point and shoot if you ignore all of the options, but focus is never quite right.

Reviews.Title: Great pictures, slow flash, battery eater!
Reviews.Author: hugejay44
Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace a 4MP camera, and the difference in picture quality is immediately evident.  This camera takes really nice pictures!  On the "easy" setting, it's a very simple, very reliable point-and-shoot camera.  The two drawbacks of this camera are the slow flash and the battery life.  The flash needs to "charge," which sometimes takes as long as 5-6 seconds.  Try catching your kids playing with a 5 second delay--pretty difficult!  Also, it EATS batteries.  I haven't had a pair of AAs last longer than two sessions of about 20 pictures each and maybe a 1 minute video.  I haven't tried rechargeable batteries yet, but at this rate, they're probably worth it.  I like the camera, and I can live with the drawbacks.  Just be aware--especially for the delayed pictures in low light.

Reviews.Title: Great camara but the battery no so good
Reviews.Author: Yrene Flores
Reviews.Content: It is a great camera with a great picture, however the battery is not a great deal, because it runs out so quickly that it is annoying, I just bought like 15 days ago and I have already bought new batteries.

Reviews.Title: A point and shoot with a big camera feel
